Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new items of jewelry for enlarging the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Violet Mideva

texts.en:
Violet Mideva O. is 29 years old and is married to Joseph O., who operates a motorbike in Kisumu town. They have four children attending school. Violet sells school bags and suitcases in Kisumu City. Her monthly income is Kshs.5,000.

Mideva has never borrowed from any other MFI, and she is applying for first loan of Kshs. 21,000 from KADET LTD to add more stock of bags and suitcases. She will use the profit to plough back into the business, so that it can grow to provide a stable income.

She hopes to open up a wholesale shop of bags and suitcases in the future.

loans.use: To add more stock of school bags and suitcases.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated her retail shop for six months, whereby she sells sugar, bread, milk, and rice to her neighbours and supplies to schools. Elizabeth faces the major challenge of transportation. During transportation of eggs to her retail shop there is a lot of breakage, hence losses in the business. She hopes to be a supplier of eggs for the hotels in future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a water pump to start selling fresh water. She decided to join Yehu to get loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump to start selling fresh water.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet N. lives in Bwaise, a neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, two of whom are in school.  Harriet has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Harriet sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.

Harriet has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more clothing materials and threads. She also generates additional income through selling second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include transportation, thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to buy a plot of land and also educate her children up to university. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials and threads.

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr:
Composé de 5 femmes mariées, les membres du groupe ALLIANCE de l’association SABOUGNOUMA, ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et de 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Par des relations d’amitiés et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de beurre de karité et de céréales avec DIAKASSA T. qui a la grande tasse en mains. 
Dans le souci d’améliorer ses capacités d’achat afin et de faire le stock, elle décida d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est à sa première expérience. 
Madame DIAKASSA T. fait le commerce de céréales dans le grand marché de BOUGOUNI. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de sa belle mère.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 400kg de petit mil, 200kg de fonio et 100kg de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fournisseurs venant des villages environnants. Toutes les ventes se font dans le marché de BOUGOUNI en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle envisage obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 
25000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les frais éducatifs des enfants.
texts.en:
All five of them married women, the members of the ALLIANCE group from the SABOUGNOUMA association are on average 28 years old and have on average two children. They live in traditional connubial families with their husbands, children, brothers and sisters. These women reside in the TORAKABOUGOU neighborhood of the town of BOUGOUNI (Mali's third administrative region).
They have met through bonds of friendship and trade, and trade in shea butter and cereals with DIAKASSA T. (who holds the large container).
In order to improve her buying power and to build up her stock, she decided to adhere to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which this is her first experience.
Mrs. DIAKASSA T. trades in cereals at the grand market of BOUGOUNI. She learned this activity from her mother-in-law. With this loan, she plans on purchasing 400 kilos of millet, 200 kilos of fonio and 100 kilos of corn. She gets her stocks from suppliers coming from neighboring villages. She only sells cash and retail at the BOUGOUNI market, to a customer base made of men and women.
With this loan, she expects to create a monthly benefit of 25,000 CFA francs while the other group members count on a 20,000 CFA francs monthly benefit, to be used towards the children's schooling expenses.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SINIGNESSIGUI est constitué des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier HEREMAKONO-NORD de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Par des relations de mariage et de commerce, ces femmes se sont connues et font le commerce de boissons non alcoolisées appelée sucrerie, de jus et de céréales à l’image de WARABA D. qui a le papier en main dans la photo. 
Pour atténuer ses soucis d’approvisionnement afin de servir plus de clients, elle a décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est à leur premier  prêt de groupe. 
Madame WARABA D. fait le commerce de céréales depuis une dizaine d’année dans le marché de BOUGOUNI. Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 600kg de petit mil et 400kg de haricot auprès des fournisseurs des villages environnants de BOUGOUNI. Les céréales seront vendues en détail et au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle comptent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 
30000 FCFA alors que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 22500FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Sinignessigui group is made up of married women, who average 26 years of age and have on average three children each. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands, in the Heremakono-Nord district of the town of Bougouni, the Republic of Mali's third administrative region.

These women met each other through marriage links and business and sell non-alcoholic drinks (known as "sucrerie"), juice and, in the case of Waraba D. who is holding a piece of paper in her hand on the photo, cereals. In order to cope with the issue of getting sufficient supplies to serve more customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, from whom she is taking out her first group loan. 

Mrs. D. has been selling cereals for around ten years in the market at Bougouni. With this loan she is planning to buy 600kg of pearl millet and 400kg of beans from suppliers in the villages surrounding Bougouni. The cereals are sold retail for cash to a customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 300,000FCFA, while the other members of the group are expecting to make 22,500FCFA, which will be used for their children's health costs.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married woman with four children, three of whom graduated while one still attends school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. She cites food for the family as her greatest monthly expense.

For over ten years, she has operated her vegetable stall business, selling green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, and fruits to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major obstacle of seasonality. During winter rainy seasons, demand for green vegetables is low and supply is high, compared to summer hot seasons, where supply is lower than demand.

Mwanahawa hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of green vegetables, a sack of potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of green vegetables, a sack of potatoes, and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Margrate

texts.en: Margrate K. is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, and tomatoes, and is requesting a loan to stock more onions and bags of beans to sell. Margrate is 42 years old and is married to a businessman. She has 2 children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more onions and bags of beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 56 year old married man from Lebanon. He has made his living as a professional driver. He has operated a van service for students in his village, as well as neighboring towns, for over 12 years. In addition, he presents transportation services for customers upon request. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform much needed maintenance on his van, including changing the tires and repairing the engine. In the future, he is planning to purchase a new van and to employ a part time employee to work on it.

loans.use: To perform much needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean N. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs and tea in a restaurant, and is requesting a loan to stock more food stuffs in the restaurant.  Jean is 28 years old and is married to a businessman. She has no children yet. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more food stuffs in the restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more bags of groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. N. lives in Naguru, a neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  Rose has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for many years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Rose sells her products from home, by means of retail.

Rose has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling local brew and firewood. The main business challenge(s) for Rose includes transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and also educating her children up to university. Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more beans to sell.

loans.name: Jacklime

texts.en:
Jackline N. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, beans, simsim (sesame seeds), cow peas and groundnuts. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of cow peas and beans to sell.  

Jackline is 30 years old and married to a businessman. She has six children and only five of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Stock more bags of cow peas and beans to sell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with four children: three boys and one girl, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated her tailoring business from home and sells to her neighbors and passersby. She cites competition as a major challenge as she is located near her competitors. Janet hopes to add more sewing machines and employ people. 

With the 15,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a bundle of cloth materials. Janet decided to work with Yehu to access loans and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloth materials

loans.name: Evas

texts.en:
Evas K. lives in Kisaasi, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She and her husband have five children, all of whom are in school. Evas sells bananas at market for a living and has been in this business for over 10 years. She works six days a week. Her primary business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Evas has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale.  Her goal is eventually to own a delivery van, thus overcoming her transportation hurdle. She aspires to see her children educated through university level.

Evas and her family live in a rented home with access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is 20 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  Her husband is a businessman. Rose is currently in the business of selling beans, onions, simsim, groundnut, and coffee.  She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim and beans to sell.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to provide home necessities and expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more bags of simsim and beans to sell

loans.name: Davy-Herman-Clotaire

texts.fr:
Homme celibataire et père d'un enfant agé de 8ans dont une personne en charge.Il debute son commerce de cafétariat en 2004 avec un capital de 100000frs. ses potentiel clients sont des vendeurs du marché des écoliers et des chauffeurs de taxi.ses recettes sont 10000 à 35000frs par jours.
 ce prêt lui permettra d'acheter des boits de chauffe et du charbon de reserve, des bôite de lait, du sucre, des spaghettis,des boites de matinal et café, du caucisson sec, des pains,des friandises.
IL reserve un bon étallage et acceuil à ses client et ceux en depit des problemes de ravitaillement lié aux moyens financier.
il à pour strategie d'offrir à ses clients des prix hors concurrance.
il aimerait offrir un cadre reposant et proper à ses client ainsi que un quantenaire d'alimentation et une boucherie dans les jours futurs.pour sa famille il veut que ses enfants frequentes dans les plus grandes écoles et améliorer leus condition de vie.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a single man, with an 8-year old child and one dependent. He launched his snack stand in 2004, with a starting capital of 100,000 West African Francs. His potential customers are market vendors, school children and taxi drivers. His sales range from 10,000 to 35,000 West African Francs per day.

This loan will allow him to purchase boxes of firewood, and charcoal as well as a supply of milk, sugar, pasta, breakfast foods and coffee, dry sausage, rolls, sweets, etc. He offers his customers a good product selection and service, in spite of financial difficulties with restocking his goods. His strategy is to offer unbeatable prices to his customers. He would like to offer a relaxing and clean environment to his clients and eventually to open an eatery and a butcher shop. As to his family, he would like his children to attend the best colleges and have a better life.

loans.use: Purchasing pasta, milk, sugar, bread, coffee, sweets etc

loans.name: Lucian

texts.en:
Lucian K. is married with one daughter, aged eight, who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food, electricity, and school fees.  Lucian has operated her water selling business for the last five years.  She also has a tailoring business in her home providing an additional source of income. Lucian faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to open a tailoring shop at the marketplace in the future. 

Lucian joined Yehu to access loans and improve her business. With the KES 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase a bundle of cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy M. lives in Kisaasi, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has five children, four of whom are in school. Cissy sells used clothes at market for a living and has been in this business for over 10 years. She works six days a week. Her primary business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. 

Cissy has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. Her business goal is to start importing bales of second-hand clothes. 

Cissy owns her own home and has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes to offer for sale at market

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El señor Alcides R. es oriundo de la ciudad de Ybycui específicamente del barrio San Francisco de ésta ciudad, está casado hace 7 años con  Gladys Olmedo Gimenez con quien tiene un hijo.
         El señor Alcides empezó vendiendo en su local tarjetas para teléfonos celulares, luego viendo la necesidad que tenían sus clientes de hablar a sus parientes, amigos o a cualquier otra persona que se encontraban en cualquier punto del país, montó una cabina telefónica el cual le resulto muy bien.
              Hace poco montó también un cyber, el cual le resulto muy beneficioso ya que cuenta con muchísimos clientes, los cuales que en ocasiones ya se quedaban sin poder usar una maquina ya que estaban todas ocupadas.
         En busca de ampliar su negocio y en consecuencia sus ganancias se acercó a nuestra oficina con el fin de solicitar un crédito para poder comprar más computadoras. Agradece a la Fundación el crédito otorgado ya que con eso pudo ampliar su negocio y comprar más máquinas.
texts.en:
Alcides R. is a native of the city of Ybycui, and specifically from the San Francisco neighborhood.  He's been married for seven years to Gladys Olmedo Gimenez, with whom he has one son.

Alcides began selling telephone cards for cell phones.  Later, seeing his clients' need to speak with their relatives, friends and others throughout the country, he installed a telephone booth, which has been very successful.  He also recently set up internet access, which is very popular and attracts many clients.  Occasionally, there are more customers than there are machines.

Looking to expand his business and thereby his earnings, Alcides came to our office requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more computers.  He extends thanks to the Foundation for the authorized loan with which he will be able to expand his business and buy more machines.

loans.use: Purchase of computers.

loans.name: Viviana Patricia

texts.es:
Viviana Patricia D. 28 años tiene, en su casa ubicada en el barrio CiudadeL. 20 D. Julio,  varios negocios: alquiL.  lavadoras, ofrece  servicios D. telefonía celular y comercializa  mercancías variadas para toda ocasión; con todas estas actividades genera ingresos, para el sostenimiento D. su pequeño hijo D. 4 años D. edad, a su lado en L. fotografia. 

DesD. hace un poco más D. 3 años está vinculada a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante proceso D. crédito y capacitación y ha logrado  sostener su negocio y también  aumentar sus ingresos con L. compra D. lavadoras con las cuales ofrecer el servicio que últimamente adicionó. Hoy muy entusiasmada por con su nuevo ingreso va a , para seguir creciendo esta es L. razón por L. cual solicita a L. Fundación su credikiva para el logro D. este propósito.
Cuando Viviana inició en el año 2008 había dejado D. ser empleada D. una empresa y se dedicó a L. atención D. su hijo por las mañanas y a una actividad que le generará ingresos desD. las 11: 00  del día, para irse preparando económicamente y estudiar en L. Universidad  Contaduría pública; este último aun sigue siendo su sueño mas deseado, porque tendría mayores herramientas para controlar su negocio y asesorar varias microempresas, además D. poder ofrecerle a su hijo mejores oportunidades y mas apoyo profesional en su educación futura. En L. actualidad Viviana tiene en su mercado mucha competencia, pero se sostiene por sus buenos precios y su vocación D. servicio que hace que sus clientes L. prefieran y que elL. continúe con L. meta del crecimiento progresivo D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Viviana Patricia is 28 years old. In her house, located in the "20th of July" neighborhood, she operates several businesses: she rents washing machines, offers cell phone services, and sells a variety of merchandise for all occasions. With all of these activities, she generates income to support her little 4-year-old son, who is at her siD. in the photo. 

For a little more than 3 years, she has been affiliated with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, through its loan and training program, and she has been able to maintain her business and also increase her income by purchasing washing machines, allowing her to add her most recent service. Today, she is very enthusiastic about her new income and wants to continue expanding, so she is requesting a Kiva loan to achieve this aim. 

When Viviana began, in 2008, she left her job as employee in a company and dedicated herself to caring for her son in the mornings and pursuing an income-generating activity starting at 11:00 a.m., so that she could prepare herself economically and study Public Accounting at the university. The latter goal continues to be her greatest dream, because she would have more effective tools to manage her business and proviD. consulting to various microenterprises. In addition, she could offer her son better opportunities and more professional support in his future education. Currently, Viviana has a lot of competition on the market, but she is holding her own thanks to her good prices and her dedication to service which causes her customers to prefer her, allowing her to continue working toward the goal of gradually expanding her business.

loans.use: Buying two washing machines and adding new cell phone plans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr:
femme de 38ans celibataire et mère de 4 enfants agée de 23ans à 8ans.Elle debute son commerce dans l'un des marché de la ville en 1992 avec un capital de 100000frs.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité en achetant des tomates fraiches, des choux,des pommes de terre,de la ciboule, de l'ail, des aubergines,des poivrons.
Malgré les difficiltés d'approvisionnement de certaines marchandises,elle séefforce à avoir une bonne gestion, reserve un bon étallage et un bon acceuil à ses clients.
ses Ambitions sont d'élargir son activite sur tous les marché congolais de la ville et devenir grossiste ainsi que offrir une bonne scolarisation à ses enfants et inscrire ses deux fille ainée dans des écoles de couture et de coiffure.
elle jouit d'une bonne réputation dans sa maison et son quartier.
texts.en:
This  38-year old woman is the mother of four, from 23 to 8 years of age. She had launched her business at one of the town markets in 1992, with a starting capital of 100,000 West African Francs. This loan will allow her to bolster her business by purchasing fresh tomatoes, cabbage, potatoes, scallions, garlic, eggplants, peppers, etc. In spite of the difficulty restocking some of her produce, she puts in an effort to manage her business well, maintain her stock level and offer a warm welcome to her customers. Her goals are to extend her business presence to all Congolese markets in her town and become a wholesaler, as well as to provide a good institution for her children and enroll her two older daughters in school for sewing and hairdressing.

She enjoys a good reputation in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Purchasing tomatoes,onions, eggplants, cabbage, scallions, garlic etc.

loans.name: Asi Akosua

texts.en: Asi Akosua G. sells jewelry at Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is an electrician. Asi Akosua has been selling jewelry for some time now. She has no educational background. Her loan will be used to buy more jewelry to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca T. has four children. She sells onions and tomatoes at Abura by moving around the area. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a mason. Rebecca will use the loan to purchase more onions and other foodstuffs to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more onions and other foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells sandals, slippers and shoes at Abura. Ama has received a junior high education. She is a widow taking care of three children. She responsibly sees to the well-being of her family from the sales she makes. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods to sell. She anticipates reinvesting her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods to sell

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana F. sells doughnuts and chips at Abura. She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare doughnuts to sell. Joana uses her income to pay utillity bills. 

Joana has two children and her husband is a driver. She has received a junior high education. With the revenue from her extended business, Joana plans to re-invest in her business.

In this picture, Joana is sifting the flour that she will use to make a fresh batch of doughnuts.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to prepare doughnuts to sell.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is a 47-year-old pepper producer who lives in the region of Upala in the Northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Victor is a dedicated father and producer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne peppers in an effort to improve living conditions. He works in cooperation with his family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities.  In addition to his agricultural activity, Victor feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Victor and his family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Victor is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Victor and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All laborial and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Victor, with the help of his family members in the region of Upala. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Victor planted his peppers 4 months ago and will expect to harvest in the next 8 months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Victor and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA, represents a unique opportunity to Victor, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Victor wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase of agricultural ingredients and chemicals.

loans.name: Reebok Group

texts.en:
Lawama A. is in her late 30s, married, and has four children. She has been running a small food vendor business for the past four years. Lawema works daily between 7 pm and midnight and earns a low monthly profit.

This will be Lawama's fifth loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to help increase her stock of goods, buying rice, wheat, and other stock at wholesale prices.  She has successfully paid back her loans. With this loan, Lawama again aims to increase her stock in charcoal, rice, beans, and cooking oil. 

Lawama will share the loan with her loan group Reebok, which totals 20 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Lawama is seen as the first on the right in the front row.

loans.use: To increase in stock of goods

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. brews a local beer and sells it in retail from her home for a living. She has been in this business for over 10 years and works seven days a week. Her primary business challenges are transportation and the rainy season. Mary lives in Kamwokya Kifumbira, a neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are in school.

Mary has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of millet flour, cassava flour, and maize bran.  She also generates additional income through hair plaiting. Her business goal is to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

Mary and her family live in a rented home and have access to electricity, although they do not have access to piped water. Mary's major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of millet flour, cassava flour, and maize bran for her brewing business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last three months, Margaret has operated a business selling shoes, clothing, and other items from her home to her neighbors. She hopes to build a permanent shop to sell her products in the future. Her primary business challenge is seasonality. 

She decided to work with Yehu so she can access loans to boost her new business. With the Kshs 20,000 she has requested, she wants to purchase a bundle of tea leaves to offer for resale. 

Margaret and her husband have two children, one still small and the other enrolled in school. The family lives in a rented house that has electricity but not piped water. Margaret's largest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of tea leaves to offer for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice K. sells secondhand clothes at Abura. She has two children. Her husband is a policeman. She assists her husband to take care of her family. She has a junior high level of education. Her loan will be used to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.	

In front of her are some few used clothings on display.

loans.use: To buy more secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is part of the communal bank “Vida Nueva” (New Life) and resides by the commune Longaví.  For the past year and a half Yolanda has been running a small grocery store of non-perishable goods from her house.  Before this Yolanda worked in her mother´s business of leasing costumes. Her husband, who is also a borrower of Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, sells coal and vegetables from a cart (a horse-drawn carriage) in the commune of Longaví.

Yolanda and her husband are parents to a 4 year old daughter and her husband has two other young daughters from a previous marriage. 

With this loan Yolanda will purchase non-perishable merchandise to stock the grocery store and also sweets to sell.

Yolanda´s house suffered some damage from the last big earthquake (February 27, 2010) causing one of the walls of the house (which is made of adobe) to lean out of place only being sustained by the other side wall.  Fortunately, Yolanda has the money to make the repairs but is waiting for the warmer weather, as making the repairs would open would expose her entire house.

For Yolanda it has been helpful to work with Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza, and she likes the system of weekly payments as she feel she gets out of debt more quickly and can still see some gains, too.  Yolanda is also grateful for the disposition of her loan officer.

Longaví is a commune in the Maule Region of central Chile.  Its name in Mapudungun (the Mapuche language) stands for “snake head.” Primarily a farming community, it is situated between mountains, foothills and mountains of lush natural beauty, with its highest point being Mount Longaví, with an altitude of 3,242 meters.

loans.use: to buy merchandise/non-perishable goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of agricultural nutrients and chemicals.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en: Emelia A. sells soap, fresh and smoked fish at Abura. Emelia has received a junior high education. She is a widow and has five dependants. She responsibly takes care of her family with the income she makes from her sales. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke and to sell. She hopes to save to buy another refrigerator to store her fish.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to smoke and to sell.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, de 44 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 son menores y el mayor trabaja, juntos tratan de salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Siempre pensó en brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, es por esta razón que cuando se quedo sola no dudo en empezar a trabajar en lo que mejor sabía hacer, que era cocinar. Y desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de diversos platillos preparados al paso, como salchipapas (papas fritas y hot dog)  y papas rellenas (fritas con relleno de carne molida); que son muy buscados por su exquisitez y sus precios cómodos. Su jornada laboral empieza a las 4 de la tarde cuando instala una mesa con bancas en la parte de afuera de su casa; y el horario de trabajo suele prolongarse hasta la medianoche, cuando ya no le queda nada de comida para ofrecer. Esta muy satisfecha, pues sus hijos la ayudan en la atención, de es manera logra considerables ganancias diarias, que le están permitiendo salir adelante. Además como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa, pues quiere un negocio más estable y tranquilo. Es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete que cumplirá puntualmente son el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Marcela tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor como arroz, aceite y azúcar que necesita para ofrecer mayor variedad de platillos a sus comensales, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Marcela, 44, lives in her own home with her 3 children.  One of her children works and the other two are minors.  Together, with a lot of effort, they try to get ahead.  She has always thought of providing the best for her children, and for this reason when she was left alone she did not hesitate to start to work the best way that she could, which was to cook.  For the last 5 years she has been selling a variety of fast food dishes such as salchipapas (hot dog with fried potatoes) and papas rellenas (fried potato with ground meat filling), that are sought after because they are delicious and cheap.  Her working day begins at 4 in the afternoon when she puts a table with benches in an area outside her house, and her working hours usually extend until midnight when there is no food left to offer.  She is very pleased, because since her children help her to serve the customers she gets considerable daily earnings that allow her to get ahead.  In addition, as she is a very enterprising woman, she plans in the future to set up a grocery store in her house because she wants to have a business that is more stable and tranquil.  This is the 5th loan that she has taken with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time, since she does not want to disappoint the people who have made this loan possible which will allow her to continue to work and make progress.  Marcela will use the loan she requests to buy ingredients that she needs at wholesale, such as rice, cooking oil, and sugar, so that she can offer a variety of dishes to her customers.  In this way she hopes to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and products so that she can continue to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Asanah

texts.en: Asanah M. sells cooked rice at Abura. Asanah has attained a junior high level of education. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a driver. Asanah has been selling cooked rice for some time now. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be added to her initial capital to increase her business. She hopes to use the new revenue from her business to save to acquire land.

loans.use: To be added to her initial capital to increase her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort J. sells groundnuts, corn mix and bananas at Abura. Comfort has been through senior high school. She has three children and is married to an electrician. Her loan will enable her to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest in the sale of other types of fruits. If she has any further incremental sales, she would use the profits to educate her children.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Ghyslain  Parfait

texts.fr:
homme de 30ans marié et père d'un enfant de 5ans ayant 4 personnes à sa charge. Après ses études universitaire n'ayant pas eu de l'offre sur le marché du travail, il se lance dans le commerce de l'alimentation en decembre 2009 avec un capital de 250000frs.ses recettes par jours sont de 6000 à 25000frs.

Avec ce prêt il veut renforcer son activité en achetant des boîte de conserve, des papier hygieniques,des boites de lait,des spaghetti, des boîte d'allumette, du fromage,du savon,pax.
 il à pour strategie de jouer sur les prix pour attirer les clients et de reserver un bon acceuil.

il aimerai être grosiste dans les jours futures grace à ses epargnes.Il veut aussi que sa famillé s'épanouisse socialement et veut faire de sa femme une commerçante.

Il jouit d'une bonne reputation
texts.en:
This 30-year old man is married, with one 5-year old child and four dependents to provide for.   Unable to obtain employment after his university studies, in December 2009 he launched a grocery business with a starting capital of 250,000 West African Francs. His daily sales range between 6,000 and 25,000 West African Francs. 

With this loan he would like to bolster his business by purchasing some canned foods, toilet paper, milk packs, pasta, matches, cheese, soap, Pax detergent etc. His strategy is to have attractive practice and offer a warm welcome to his customers. Some time in the future, he would like to save enough to become a wholesaler. He would like for his family to advance socially and for his wife to become an entrepreneur. 

He enjoys a good reputation.

loans.use: Purchasing soap, Pax detergent,canned food, mik packs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes B. cooks banku and serves it with pepper sauce and fried fish at Abura. Agnes has a junior high level of education. She is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a teacher. She responsibly supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will serve as increased capital, hence expanding her business. She anticipates reinvesting the profit that will accrue from her business.

loans.use: As increased capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:

He works to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. In addition to his agricultural activity, Guillermo feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Guillermo lives is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Guillermo is working hard and striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Guillermo and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Guillermo. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Guillermo planted his peppers four months ago and will expect to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Guillermo and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Guillermo, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve living conditions for Guillermo as well as the community at large. Above all, Guillermo wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. is married to an accountant and has five dependants. She has received a junior high level of education.  Agnes sells jewelry and water at Abura. Agnes uses her income to feed the home as a way of supporting her husband. Agnes will use the loan to buy jewelry to restock her case. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to reinvest back her into her business.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to restock her case.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Señor  Alfredo R., tiene 43 años de edad, es viudo con 2 hijos, todos mayores de edad.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 25 años, empezó trabajando con su tío, el cual se dedicaba a éste rubro hace ya más de 30 años. 
Luego su tío falleció y se quedo sin trabajo, se le vino en  mente la idea de abrir una carpintería propia, para comenzar con su carpintería, tuvo que vender un terreno, que recibió como herencia de su madre. 
    Nos cuenta también que su señora en vida lo ayudaba mucho para que puedan seguir adelante y así poder darles la posibilidad de estudiar a sus hijos  para tener una mejor calidad de vida. 
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de maderas para fabricar  muebles ya que tiene muchos pedidos de los mismos. 
Agradece mucho a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Alfredo R. is 43 years old and a widower with 2 children who older in age. He has been in this field (furniture making) for more than 25 years. He started working with his uncle, who worked in this area of work for more than 30 years. Later, his uncle died and he found himself out of work. He had an idea to open his own carpenter’s workshop. He had to sell a plot of land which he had received as an inheritance from his mother.

He also tells us that his female companion helps him a lot so that he can make progress. Therefore, he is able to give his children the possibility to study so they can have a better quality of life.

The requested loan is for buying wood to make furniture, since he now has many orders. He is grateful for the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan offered.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula, de 65 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su hija mayor y sus 2 nietos, juntos luchan cada día para salir adelante. Cada día es de trabajo constante,  para esta empeñosa mujer, y a pesar de su avanzada edad continua con sus labores de siempre, con el único fin de terminar de construir su casa de material noble. Se levanta muy temprano para atender y brindar alimento a sus animales de corral, que cría con esmero. Su vida transcurre apacible, pues logra buenas ganancias del alquiler de 2 cuartos que tiene en su casa; y hace 5 años empezó con este negocio ante la ausencia de su esposo ya que no quería ser una carga para sus hijos. En la actualidad tiene muchos planes, y entre ellos se encuentra el de terminar de construir su casa, pues tiene planeado alquilar 2 habitaciones; de esta manera espera generarse regulares ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas con puntualidad, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar con el alquiler de su vivienda, y así espera concretar sus planes. Paula tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales (cuartos semi-fabricados, clavos, y calaminas) para acondicionar las habitaciones que tienen para alquilarlos, de esa manera espera mejorar sus rentas y así terminar de construir toda su casa.
texts.en:
Paula is 65 years old and lives in her own home with her adult daughter and two grandchildren.  They work together daily to get ahead.  This enterprising woman works constantly every day.  Despite her advanced age, she continues with her usual labors, with the goal of finishing the building of her home with good quality materials.

She rises very early to tend to and feed the corral animals that she raises with care.  Her life passes gently and she makes a good income from renting out two rooms in her home.  She started doing this five years ago because of her husband’s absence and because she did not want to be a burden on her children.  She now has many plans and among them are to finish building her house because she plans to lease out two more rooms and she hopes to generate a regular income.

This will be her first loan through MFP and she is committed to being punctual with her payments because she doesn’t want to be in bad light with those who provided the money that will allow her to continue to rent out her home and solidify her plans.

Paula plans to invest the money from this loan in building materials (prefabricated rooms, nails, and roofing material) to prepare the rooms she has to rent out.  In this way she hopes to improve her income and finish building her entire house.

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Mayra

texts.en:
Mayra is a 37-year-old mother and pepper producer who lives in the region of Upala in the Northern part of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Mayra is a dedicated producer and mother. She plans to focus her efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne peppers. She works in cooperation with her family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land she works is her own. In addition to her agricultural activity, Mayra feels it is important to be an active member of her community. As a result, she dedicates a significant portion of her time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Mayra and her family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Mayra is working hard towards the sustenance of her family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from her land as well as her labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Mayra and her family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Mayra with the help of her family members in the region of Upala. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Mayra expects to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, she dedicates the hours from 7AM to 4PM everyday to her agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Mayra and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Mayra, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Mayra wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Wara Wara De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “WARA WARA DE LOS ANDES” (estrella de los Andes) es una asociación que está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de los Andes.  Está compuesta por once integrantes, diez socias y un socio.  Se reunirán cada quince días, para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas, permitiéndoles  conocerse mejor.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Leonarda como presidenta, la señora Carmen como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Rosemary.

La señora  Carmen es una mujer joven de 24 años de edad, como tesorera de su asociación tiene la delicada tarea de controlar el ingreso y egreso de las cuotas.   Con respecto a su negocio, ella tiene un taller de costura, su experiencia en el área ya suma más de 7 años.  La señora Carmen solicitó Bs.2000.-,  esperando comprar tela.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación, son variados: taller de costura, venta de pan, carpintería, tienda surtida, venta de bolsas plásticas, venta de chuño por mayor, servicio de serigrafía, venta de comida venta de mantas tejidas, macramé y tejido de mantas, taller de costura.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Wara Wara de los Andes" (Star of the Andes) is a group that is requesting a loan for the first time from the Andean central office of Pro Mujer Bolivia.  This group has 11 members: 10 women and one man.  They will meet every 15 days, for training and to make their payments, which will allow them to get to know each other better.  The board is comprised of Leonarda, who is president, Carmen, who is the treasurer, and Rosemary, who is the recording secretary.

Carmen is a young woman who is 24 years old.  As treasurer, she has the delicate task of accounting for the inflows and outflows of funds.  With respect to her business, she has a sewing workshop and she has 7 years of experience in this line of work.  She requests 2,000 Bolivianos to buy fabric.

With respect to the businesses that support the rest of the members of the communal bank, they are varied, including: a sewing workshop, the sale of bread, carpentry, a general store, the sale of plastic bags, the sale of potato flour at wholesale, silk-screen printing, the sale of food, and the sale of woven blankets and macrame.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana M. is married and has two children. She prepares Fante kenkey at Abura to sell. Nana uses her income to help her husband take care of her family. Nana will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to prepare her kenkey to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize to prepare her kenkey to sell.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa E. moves around in her locality to sell her detergent at Abura. She is married to a carpenter and has been through junior high school. Adjoa has been in this business for three years now. Adjoa will use the loan to purchase more detergent to resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to save to build a shop to display her goods.

loans.use: To purchase more detergent to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. has four children and is a palm oil and kernel extractor at Abura. She has a senior high level of education. Elizabeth has been in this trade for five years. Elizabeth uses her income to see to the upkeep of the home. Elizabeth says the loan will help her to extend her business. With the new revenue from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to save to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: To help her to extend her business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 52 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo José de 55 años, que es mecánico y de sus jóvenes hijos, juntos trabajan cada día en busca del progreso. Desde hace 5 años, instaló en su casa una tienda de comestibles y con el tiempo ha ido surtiéndola de a poco. En la actualidad ofrece golosinas, comestibles, gaseosas, cervezas y también algunos útiles de escritorio; sin lugar a duda es una de las tiendas mejor abastecidas de la zona, es por esta razón que se siente muy orgullosa de su negocio. Dice que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque le permite obtener buenas ganancias, sin descuidar las labores de su hogar; pero lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces no puede salir muy seguido, pero cuando lo hace sus hijos la apoyan en la atención del negocio. Además manifiesta, con mucha convicción, que para el futuro quiere mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, pues quiere ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Rosa tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para surtir mejor su tienda.
texts.en: Rosa, 52, lives in her own home in the company of her husband, José (55, a mechanic), and their young children. They work together each day in search of progress. 5 years ago Rosa installed a grocery store in her home, and little by little over time she stocked it with goods. She offers lollies, groceries, soft drinks, beer, and some stationery items; without doubt it is one of the best stocked shops in the zone. Rosa feels very proud of her business because of this. She says that she really likes working as it allows her to obtain good earnings without neglecting her household work; but what she doesn't like is that often she can't go out. However, when she does, her children help her attend to the business. She affirms with much conviction that in the future she wants to improve her shop fittings so she can offer greater comfort to her customers. This is Rosa's sixth loan with MFP and she promises to punctually make her repayments, as she doesn't want to have a bad relationship with the people that have made possible the money which she uses to continue working in search of progress. Rosa plans to invest the loan in the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise to better stock her shop.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Elisa Trinidad

texts.es: Elisa Trinidad R. C. de 47 años de edad, reside junto a su madre en el departamento de San Salvador. Elisa trabaja muy duro día con día comercializando ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa de forma ambulante, así mismo comercializa cuadros y portarretratos. Ella recorre grandes distancias para poder vender por lo menos la mitad de su mercadería diaria, de esta manera ella se asegura poder obtener ganancias las cuales no solo le permitan solventar los gastos de la casa, sino también, seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, lo cual en muchas ocasiones es algo difícil. Es por esto que Elisa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda poseer el dinero necesario para comprar más ropa.
texts.en: Elisa Trinidad R. C. is 47 years old and lives together with her mother in the San Salvador department. Elisa works very hard day to day selling clothing for men, women and children. She sells door to door, and also sells paintings and photoframes. Elisa covers large distances to be able to sell at least half of her stock every day, and in this way she is sure she can obtain earnings which not only let her cover her household costs but also continue investing in her business, which on many occasions is very difficult. Is it for this reason that Elisa is seeking a loan with which to have the necessary money to purchase more clothing.

loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 48 years old with 6 children between the ages of 8 and 20. He is married to a farmer. All of his children go to school.

He sells cow meat and he has spent 3 years in this business.  With the loan he will buy more meat to sell. With the profit he will save money. His business is known because most of his customers like meat.

He dreams of doubling his business to the extent of getting a big return from one cow that he has slaughtered.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Felipa María Eva

texts.es: Felipa María Eva F. Vda. D. L. D. 73 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, ella vive sola debido a que enviudó hace un par D. años atrás, es por esta razón que ella trabaja muy duro para poder sostener su negocio y D. esta forma contar con todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna. Con el deseo D. poder vivir mejor, desD. hace 5 años y medio que Felipa inició su propio negocio el cual es una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Felipa atienD. el negocio D. lunes a domingo, su faena inicia cada día a las 6 D. la mañana y termina a las 10 D. la noche, a pesar que su trabajo es pesado ya que debe atender clientes a lo largo del día, le permite estar en su casa y así mismo vender con sus vecinos los cuales la conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo atrás. Es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir comprando mayor cantidad D. productos D. primera necesidad y D. esta manera mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en: Felipa María Eva F. Vda. D. L. is 73 years old and lives in the San Salvador department. She lives alone owing to the fact that she was widowed a few years ago, and for this reason she works very hard to be able to sustain her business and in this way have everything she needs to have a dignified life. With the desire to live better, 5 1/2 years ago Felipa began her own business, a grocery store, which is located in her home. Felipa attends to the shop from Monday to Sunday, and her job begins each day at 6 in the morning and finishes at 10 at night. Apart from her job being hard as she has to attend to customers during a very long day, it allows her to be in her home and sell to her neighbours, whom she has known for many years. It is for this reason that Felipa is seeking a loan to be able to invest in purchasing a greater quantity of grocery products and in this way improve her sales.

loans.use: Purchase grocery items

loans.name: Evanysa

texts.en:
Evanysa is 35 years old and she is married to a farmer. They have 3 children between 11 months and 9 years. All of their children go to school except the youngest.

She sells arts and crafts. Evanysa has spent 3 years in this business. With the loan she will buy more arts and crafts to sell. With the profit she will save money. She dreams of having a booming business to the extent of double what she has now.

loans.use: To buy more art crafts to sell

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia S. D. M. D. 71 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabajo comerciante D. productos varios, ambos viven en el departamento D. San Salvador. Tanto María como su esposo son dos personas muy trabajadoras quienes cuentan con el enorme deseo D. salir adelante. María es una señora muy alegre, la cual posee una venta D. frutas y verduras, la cual esta ubicada en el centro D. San Salvador, un lugar muy transito por muchas personas y muy apto para todo tipo D. negocio. Una D. las mayores virtudes D. ella es la D. destacarse por ser muy emprendedora, ya que siempre esta en busca D. alguna actividad para poder obtener ganancias extras para su familia. Gloria solicita un préstamo a Integral, a través del cual pueda contar con los recursos necesarios para aumentar los productos D. su venta, y así contar con frutas D. temporada y más verduras, las cuales las personas solicitan más.
texts.en: María Antonia S. D. M. is 71 years old. She lives together with her husband who works selling various products. They both live in the San Salvador department. María, as with her husband, are 2 very hard-working people who have an enormous desire to improve their lives. María is a very vivacious woman who has a fruit and vegetable store which is located in the centre of San Salvador, a zone visited by many people and apt for this type of business. One of María's biggest virtues is that she stands out as a very entrepreneurial woman, as she is always on the look out for some type of activity to obtain extra earnings for her family. She is seeking a loan from Integral so she can have the necessary resources to increase her products to sell, and in this way have seasonal fruits and more vegetables, which is what her customers ask for more of.

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables to stock her business

loans.name: Alliance Group

texts.fr:
Toutes mariées, les 4 membres du groupe ALLIANCE  de l’association SEWA, ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 1 enfant. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier HEREMAKONO de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage. 
Ces femmes font le commerce de jus de fruits, des produits alimentaires et des habits à l’image de BINTA S. qui a  un pagne blanc sur  sa tête jusqu’à l’épaule. 
Avec l’intention d’acheter assez d’habits pour satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle, elle a décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elle est à son troisième prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Madame BINTA S. vend ses habits dans un kiosque à l’auto gare de BOUGOUNI.
Avec ce prêt elle compte acheter 70 complets pour les petits garçons, 50 robes pour les jeunes filles et 20 chemises pour les adultes.
 Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO. Toutes les ventes se font en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt  Madame BINTA S. espère obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 35000 FCFA  qui selon elle sera réutilisé dans son entreprise.
texts.en:
The four members of the Alliance group (which belongs to the Sewa association) are all married women, averaging 30 years of age with an average of one child each. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands. These women live in the Heremakono district of the town of Bougouni, the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They met through relatives and neighbors.

These women sell fruit juice, food products and clothes (Binta S., who is wearing a white "pagne" wrapped around her head down to her shoulders, sells clothes). With the aim of buying enough clothes to satisfy customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and is now on her third group loan from this institution; all the previous loans have been repaid correctly.

With this loan she is planning on buying 70 outfits for small boys, 50 young girls' dresses and 20 adults' shirts. She gets her supplies from wholesalers in Bamako. All her sales are made on a retail basis, for cash and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. With this loan, Mrs. S. is hoping to make a monthly profit of 35,000FCFA, which according to her will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for repairs to a truck.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es: Rosa María R. D. C. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, donD. vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Rosa posee una tienda D. abarrotes, en los cuales comercializa productos D. primera necesidad como pastas, pan, huevos y otros más los cuales son fundamentales dentro D. un hogar. Ella cuenta con 5 años D. poseer el negocio, el cual le ha permitido ir mejorando su economía familiar, la cual en muchas ocasiones es bastante mala, sobre todo porque muchas veces ella no cuenta con todos los productos que las personas buscan lo cual disminuye en gran manera sus ganancias. Es por esta razón que Rosa solicita un préstamo a integral, con el fin D. poder contar con el dinero necesario para poder surtir su negocio con esos productos tan necesarios que no posee, así mismo con el deseo D. poder aumentar la cantidad D. los que ya posee. Rosa desea mejorar su negocio, sobretodo para brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa María R. D. C., 43, lives in the municipality of Soyapango, located in the San Salvador department, with her husband and 2 children.  Rosa has a grocery store where she sells basic consumer products such as pasta, bread, eggs and other items that are essential in the home.  She has had this business for 5 years, and it has allowed her to improve her family's economic situation, which for a time was pretty bad because she did not have the products that people were looking for and this greatly decreased her earnings.  For this reason, Rosa requests a loan from INTEGRAL, so that she can have the money to stock her store with the products that she needs but does not have, and to increase the quantity of the products that she already has.  Rosa wants to improve her business so that she can proviD. her children with everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy perishable food products

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa M. D. G. D. 61 años D. edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su hogar. Ella vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos quienes estudian. Rosa posee un comedor y pupusería, el cual esta ubicado en su casa D. habitación la cual esta ubicada en Usulután, en donD. ha trabajado durante 14 años, haciendo desayunos y al almuerzos, los cuales en un principio únicamente vendía con sus vecinos, pero que en la actualidad venD. incluso con motoristas del transporte público, lo cual le ha permitido incrementar sus ventas y así mismo ser más conocida en el lugar, Rosa necesita  poder incrementar su materia prima para poder atender a más clientes, es por esto que ella solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. verduras, granos básicos, fruta, jugos, sodas, todo lo necesario para poder atender mejor a sus clientes y así mismo atender a más clientes. Ella desea mucho poder aprovechar al máximo esta situación, debido a que es la única forma en la cual se gana la vida, y la cual le ha permitido poder sostener a sus hijos.
texts.en: Rosa M. D. G., 61, is a very hardworking person who is devoted to her family.  She lives with her husband and 2 children, who are in school.  Rosa has an eatery where pupusas (an El Salvadoran dish maD. of a corn tortilla filled with meats, cheeses or beans) are sold that is located in her home. Her home is located in Usulután, where she has worked over the last 14 years making breakfasts and lunches, which at first she sold only to her neighbors.  But now she also sells to public transportation passengers, which has allowed her to increase her sales and also become more well-known in her area.  Rosa needs more supplies so that she can sell to more customers, and this is the reason that she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL.  Through this loan she will be able to buy a greater quantity of vegetables, staple grains, fruit, juice, sodas, and everything she needs to meet the needs of her customers.  This way she can get more customers.  She wants very much to be able to take advantage of this situation, since this is the only way that she can earn a living and proviD. for her children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, and staple grains, to make food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Katebo Basooka Kwavula Group-Mpigi

texts.en: S. Lawrence, 57 years old and father of six, was inspired by his parents seven years ago to start his fish-selling business in Katebo-Mpigi. Farming has since become his major business occupation. Credit for his success he says, boils down to one factor — diligence. A cross section of clients has enabled him make ends meet although some financial, operational challenges have stifled his anticipated progress. Lawrence belongs to Katebo Basooka group-Mpigi. In a week, he makes Ksh 100,000. With this loan, he will buy more fishing nets to catch more fish to sell and make more income.

loans.use: to purchase  fishing nets

loans.name: Rosa Elba

texts.es: Rosa Elba A. D. C. 71 años D. edad, es una señora muy admirada ya que a pesar D. sus años, es una persona muy trabajadora quien lucha día con día por obtener su sustento diario. Ella vive junto a su esposo en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual posee una venta D. frutas y verduras. Rosa posee 40 años D. dedicarse a este trabajo, lo que la ha hecho muy conocida y querida en el lugar. Rosa solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. comprar mayor cantidad y variedad D. frutas,  ya que ella comercializa por mayor y así mismo por unidad, lo que le permite contar con muchas ventas. Rosa desea mejorar sus ganancias, debido a que es D. este negocio del cual ella depenD. por lo que desea mucho mejorarlo para vivir mejor en su vejez y D. esta forma contar con una vida estable y tranquila.
texts.en: Rosa Elba A. D. C., 71, is a much-admired woman because, despite her age, she still works hard, fighting each day to make her living.  She lives with her husband in Usulután Department, where she has a fruit and vegetable stand.  Rosa has been in this business for 40 years, and she is well known and loved there.  She is asking for a loan to buy a larger supply and variety of fruit.  She sells them in bulk and by the piece, which allows her to make a lot of sales.  Rosa wants to improve the income from her business so she can live better in her old age and have a stable and peaceful life.

loans.use: To buy fruit for her business

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAÏDOU est Composé essentiellement de femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier HEREMAKONO de la ville de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. 
A travers les relations d’amitiés et de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et mènent le commerce de céréales, la restauration et la vente des tubercules avec KADIA S. qui a un enfant assis sur ses pieds dans la photo. 
Dans l’intention de faire le grossiste et satisfaire les clients, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Madame KADIA S. fait le commerce des tubercules dans le marché de BOUGOUNI.  Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 200kg d’igname, 300kg de patate douce et 100kg de pomme de terre. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des fournisseurs de la ville de SIKASSO. Toutes les ventes se font dans le marché de BOUGOUNI en gros et en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt le elle espère réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel de 
40000 FCFA tandis que les autres membres du groupe comptent sur un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000F CFA dont une partie sera réutilisé dans l’entreprise, et l’autre partie dans les frais éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The Laïdou group is made up mainly of married women, who average 25 years of age with an average of two children each. They live in nuclear families with their children and husbands, in the Heremakono district of the town of Bougouni, in the Republic of Mali's third administrative region. 

These women met each other through friends and marriage and have businesses in the cereal trade, restauration and the sale of tubers (the latter being carried out by Kadia S., the lady with the child sat at her feet in the photo).

With the aim of becoming wholesalers and satisfying customer demand, they decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their third group loan from the institution; all the previous loans have been repaid correctly. 

Mrs. Kadia S. sells tubers at the market in Bougouni. With this loan she is planning to buy 200kg of yams, 300kg of sweet potatoes and 100kg of ordinary potatoes. She stocks up from suppliers in the town of Sikasso and sells all her produce in the market at Bougouni, on a wholesale and retail basis, for cash and on credit to a customer base made up of men and women. 

With this loan she hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000FCFA, while the other members of the group are counting on making a monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, part of which will be used for their businesses and part for their children's school fees.

loans.use: Purchase of tubers

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena Guadalupe P. D. E. D. 46 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y una hija menor D. edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. Ella vive junto a su familia en el departamento D. San Salvador. Morena posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su misma casa D. habitación, lo cual trae mucho beneficios, ya que pueD. dedicarse a su negocio al mismo tiempo que se dedica a su hija y a los quehaceres del hogar. Su negocio es uno D. los más surtidos del lugar y que cuenta con mayor cantidad D. clientes, tanto por su excelente servicio como por sus precios accesibles. Morena solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda obtener el dinero necesario para invertir más en su negocio, aumentando la cantidad D. cada producto, y D. esta manera poder atender a mayor cantidad D. clientes. Ella es una mujer muy responsable quien se siente muy agradecida por el hecho D. poder contar con un negocio propio el cual le permita brindarles todo lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Morena Guadalupe P. D. E., 46, lives with her husband and her youngest daughter, who is a student.  She and her family live in the department of San Salvador.  Morena has a shop selling perishables and basic goods.  The shop is attached to her home, which brings many benefits, since she can work and take care of her daughter and her home at the same time. Her business is one of the most varied in the area and has a large number of clients because of its excellent service and accessible prices.

Morena wants a loan to invest further in this business so she can increase her stock and thereby serve a greater number of clients.  She is a responsible woman, and she is happy that she has her own business, since it allows her to offer her family members what they need.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs and household products

loans.name: Puebla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama PuebL. por que las clientas se identifican por ser  el nombre D. L. ciudad, está ubicado en L. comunidad D. PuebL. en México, el grupo está conformado por 9 mujeres.

L. presidenta del grupo se llama Soledad A. L., tiene 45 años, estudió L. primaria y se dedica a L. venta D. productos para L. salud, tiene  cuatro hijos. Sus clientas opinan que doña Soledad es una persona que le gusta salir a delante y que es una mujer emprendedora e independiente por buscar un mejor D. vida para su familia, su meta es salir adelante en L. vida.

L. Sra.
