Maribel  tiene 29 años y un hijo D. siete años, elL. estudio sólo L. primaria, se dedica a L. venta D. comida y calzado desD. hace 4 años, a lo cual se dedica con gusto, sobre todo a L. venta D. sus variados alimentos, solicita el préstamo para comprar un refrigerador que le permita conservar en buen estado sus productos, sus clientas L. conocen como una mujer joven y emprendedora al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta por L. confianza que le brindaron sus compañeras D. grupo a pesar D. ser tan joven, el éxito para elL. significa darles una mejor educación a sus hijos para que no sufran las carencias D. que elL. tuvo D. niña.
texts.en:
This group is called PuebL. because its members are from the city of the same name. The group is located in the PuebL. community in México and is maD. up of 9 women.

The president of the group is called Soledad A. L.. She is 45, studied until primary school, has 4 children and works selling health products. Her clients believe that doña Soledad is a person who likes to improve her life and who is an entrepreneurial and independent woman for seeking a better life for her family. Soledad's goal is to improve her situation in life. 

Maribel is 29 years old and has a 7 year old son. She only studied primary school and has sold food and shoes for 4 years, which she does with gusto, particularly the food sales. Maribel is seeking a loan to purchase a refrigerator so that she can preserve her products. Her customers know her to be a young and entrepreneurial woman. She feels happy about seeking a loan because of the confidence bestowed on her by her companions in the group. Success to Maribel means giving her children a better education so that they don't suffer the shortages that she did as a child.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Cynthia Denisse

texts.es: La Sra. Cynthia, tiene como actividad la confección de trajes típicos de adorno para muñequitas las cuales comercializa  en el exterior del país y en nuestra ciudad, es un trabajo arduo y de mucho tiempo ya que los hace con todos sus detalles, ella vive junto a su mamá y su pequeña hija de dos años de edad, esta actividad que desarrolla le permite solventar su gastos familiares ya que es la única que mantiene el hogar, el destino del crédito será para la culminación de la ampliación de su departamento (obra fina),  la cual le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Cynthia  sews traditional costumes for dolls, which she sells outside her country and in her city. It is an arduous job which takes a lot of time as everything requires great detail. Cynthia lives together with her mother and small daughter who is 2. The activity she does allows her to cover the household costs as she is the only one that maintains their home. This loan is destined to go towards the culmination of rennovations to her apartment, which will allow her to have a better quality of life. Cynthia is a very hard-working person and is very thankful to the instutition for the support it has given her.

loans.use: Pay to finish construction

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha  es viuda ya hace varios años, tiene tres hijos, vive en anticretico en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí  de la ciudad de La Paz.
La cliente cuenta con un ambiente en alquiler el cual utiliza como horno de elaboración de pan, elaborando pan para el Hospital de la Mujer, Materno infantil y Hospital Obrero de la ciudad de La Paz. Los tres hijos le ayudan a elaborar pan todos los días  y  es así como obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar..
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de materia prima (harina, azúcar, en cantidad) y así poder aumentar sus ingresos.
Es su tercer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en: Señora Martha has been a widow for many years. She has 3 children and lives in an anticretico arrangement in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone in La Paz city. Martha rents a location where she uses a bread-making oven, making bread for the Women's, Maternity and Infants hospital and Workers' Hospital in La Paz city. Her 3 children help her make bread every day and in this way she obtains earnings for her household. The loan Martha is seeking is to purchase ingredients (catering quantities of flour and sugar) to be able to increase her earnings. This is Martha's third loan and the socioeconomic analysis which was done was favourable, allowing her to obtain a loan.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, yeast etc to make bread

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: María Auxiliadora tiene 58 años ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de taller de costura. Por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos pues ha sido de gran ayuda para mejorar su negocio e invertir en lo necesario. Por lo que este negocio lo aprendió por su Mama que anteriormente tenía un taller, con el paso del tiempo fue que decide entregárselo a Maria Auxiliadora y así fue que ella  se hace cargo. Ella tiene varios clientes que le solicitan diferentes estilos de prendas de vestir  pues siempre ofrece muy buena calidad.el motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como hilos, tijeras, agujas, tela entre otras cosas necesarias.
texts.en: María Auxiliadora is 58 years old, and she makes clothing. Because this isn’t her first loan, she knows what a big help this is in improving her business and in investing in the necessary items. This is a business that she learned from her mother, who used to have a workshop. As time went on, her mother decided to hand over the workshop to María Auxiliadora. She has various clients who request different styles of clothing, and she always offers very good quality. This loan will be used to buy raw materials, such as thread, scissors, needles, and fabric, among other items.

loans.use: Capital

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene 5 hijos todos mayores de edad; el esposo trabaja como albañil percibiendo un salario muy bajo, por lo tanto ella vende carne de cordero para ayudar en el hogar ya que no reciben ayuda de los hijos.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más carne de cordero, venderla y poder aumentar sus ingresos.

Es cliente de Impro desde al año 2006  y tiene un historial de pagos  bueno,  por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Cecilia lives in her own house in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of the city of La Paz. She is married and has 5 children, all of them grown. Her husband works as a mason, receiving a very low salary. For this reason, she sells lamb meat to help support the household, because they do not receive help from their children. 

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital, buying more lamb meat to sell, so that she can increase her income. 

She has been a client of Impro since 2006, and she has an excellent payment history, allowing her to have access to a new loan.

loans.use: Buying a larger quantity of lamb meat to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí, esta separada del esposo y vive con una sola hija; la actividad que realiza es la venta de tarjetas de teléfono en una tienda que esta ubicada en el cementerio general.

El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora que le sirva de servidor porque quiere instalar un Servicio de Internet, y de esta manera generar mas ingresos ya que tiene mucha demanda.

Fue cliente de Impro en el pasado y ahora vuelve a solicitar un nuevo crédito a través de Kiva;  por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Gladys lives in her parents' house in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosí.  She is separated from her husband and has one daughter.  She sells telephone  cards at a store located in the general cemetery.

She wants a loan in order to buy a computer so that she can install internet for her clients, which is in great demand, and thereby generate more income.

She has been a client of the Impro microfinance partner in the past and is coming back now to ask for a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a computer in order to access internet service

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 59 años, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo Félix de 60 años, que es chofer; y sus 5 hijos mayores y 2  nietos; cada día se esfuerzan juntos por trabajar y  salir adelante. Desde hace 6 meses, instaló en el patio de su casa un negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, y desde entonces obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Las 4 máquinas de videojuegos que tiene son alquiladas y se reparte las ganancias mensuales con el dueño. Como el negocio ha crecido en poco tiempo, requiere con urgencia refaccionar el patio de su casa, donde se encuentran las máquinas, pues las imperfecciones en el piso no dejan utilizar bien los videojuegos  a sus asiduos clientes. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque dice que es tranquilo y lo puede desarrollar desde la comodidad de su casa, y lo más importante es que no descuida las labores del hogar. Además como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar el negocio y comprar 2 máquinas de videojuegos para trabajar de manera independiente. Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Diana tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales para refaccionar el patio de su casa, así como el pago de mano de obra del albañil, de esta manera  espera aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Diana, age 59, lives in her own house together with her husband Félix, age 60, who is a driver, along with her 5 grown children and 2 grandchildren. Every day, they combine their efforts to work and get ahead. Six months ago, Diana established a business renting video games on the patio of her home. Since then, she has obtained a steady income which has allowed her to help her husband with the household expenses. The 4 video game machines she has are rented, and the monthly earnings are shared with the owner. Because the business has grown within a short time, she urgently needs to renovate the patio of her home, where the machines are located, because the imperfections in the floor do not allow her best customers to use the games effectively. Diana likes her work very much, because she says it is pleasant work, and she can do it from the comfort of her home, and most importantly, she does not need to neglect her work within the household. In addition, since she is an enterprising woman, she has plans to expand the business in the future and buy 2 video game machines so she can work independently. This is her third loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time, since she does not want to disappoint the people who made this funding possible, which will permit her to keep working in her quest for progress. Diana plans to invest the loan she is requesting in buying materials to renovate the patio of her home, and also paying masons for their work, and in this way she hopes to increase her earnings.

loans.use: Buying materials to renovate the floor of her patio [where her business is located] and hiring masons

loans.name: Idrissa Mohamed

texts.en: This is 32-year-old Idrissa. He is divorced and has one child, aged 12. He has five additional dependents who live with him for school assistance. In 2004, Idrissa established his cosmetics business to take care of himself and his family. Working six days a week, 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,269,000 every month. Idrissa travels to nearby Guinea to buy his products at least twice per month. He would like a loan Le 4,000,000 to buy body lotion, Colgate toothpaste, perfume, and body white. Idrissa hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profit by approximately Le 253,800. In the future, Idrissa plans to build a house and educate his child to university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy additional cosmetics

loans.name: Avelina

texts.es: La Sra. Avelina es cliente desde el año 2003, trabajo en principio en grupo solidario de tres personas llamado Princesas, todas ella de la zona de Irpavi e Irpavi alto, se dedica a esta actividad de la compra y venta de material desechable desde hace más de 10 años, ella al momento tiene dos depósitos para recolectar dicho material, uno es en la zona de  Caliri y otro en zona de Irpavi, lugares donde recogen todo lo que ella reúne en dos semanas, al margen de ello, también se dedica a la venta de muebles de segunda mano, estos los comercializa en la Feria de 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de mercadería tanto de material desechable, como también de muebles de segunda mano,  el esposo colabora con ella en los gastos, él se dedica a la construcción en la zona sur, tienen tres hijos bajo su cuidado, lo otros 3 se casaron o ya tienen su hogar independiente, esta señora es cliente cumplida y antigua por tal razón se solicita el financiamiento KIVA para ella.
texts.en:
Avelina has been a client since 2003.  In the beginning she worked with three women in a communal bank called “Princesas”.  All of them are from the Irpavi and Irpavi Alto area.  She has been buying and selling disposable materials for over ten years.

She currently has two depots to collect these materials.  One is in the Caliri area, and the other is in the Irpavi area.  Everything that she gets together in two weeks is gathered at the two locations.

She also sells second-hand furniture at the Feria de 16 de Julio in the city of El Alto.

She will use the money from the loan to buy disposable material and second-hand furniture.  Her husband collaborates with her on the expenses.  He does construction work in the southern zone.  They have three children under their care.  The other three are married or have their own homes.

This woman is a responsible, long-time client.  That is why a Kiva loan is being requested for her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La señora Ana vive en anticretico con su esposo e hija menor en la zona de San Sebastián de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene cuatro hijos, tres casados; el esposo es auditor y trabaja independientemente, ella trabaja como enfermera en el hospital donde percibe un salario. Ambos ingresos  mantienen el hograr.

El crédito que solicita es para pagar un tratamiento medico para ella en una clínica ya que el servicio de salud en Bolivia no es el adecuado y es mejor un medico particular.

Es cliente de Impro desde el año 2009 y paga muy bien, lo cual hace que pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en: Ana lives on leased land with her husband and young daughter, in the San Sebastian zone of the city of La Paz. She is married and has four children, three of whom are married; her husband is an auditor and works independently. She works as a nurse in a hospital, where she receives a salary. Their two incomes maintain the household. The loan that she is requesting is to pay for a medical treatment for herself in a clinic, since the health service in Bolivia is not adequate and private doctors are better. She has been an Impro client since 2009 and pays back very well, which has allowed her to access a new loan.

loans.use: The cost of a private medical treatment for her.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is a small market entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She sells shoes, sandals, slippers, flip-flops, etc. in one of the local marketplaces in her home town. Mariya launched the enterprise 10 years ago and currently has 20,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Her income amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Mariya is requesting a 1,000 Grivnya loan to re-stock her merchandise with seasonal inventory. She has gained a good reputation among her fellow entrepreneurs and customers. She is hard-working, enterprising, and full of energy. She is ready to invest in further development of her business.  

Note: this is a short-term express loan that will be repaid in four weeks.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: This is 41 year-old Samuel. He is married, and has four children under 12 as well as two additional dependents. He established his timber board and motor spare parts business in 2007. He started in this business as an apprentice repairing mobile phones but wanted his own business. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he now earns about Le 1,281,000 every month. Samuel would like a loan of Le 3,000,000 to buy more supplies, as he has very little competition and many customers. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profit by approximately Le 230,000. In the future, Samuel plans to build a large store for his his timber and would also like to invest on his daughter’s education. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Katerera Farmers, Bushenyi Group

texts.en: M. Vasita, aged 52, is hard working and determined. She has worked tirelessly in her five-year-old produce business that trades in beans, millet, maize, coffee and other food crops in Nyamirima trading centre, Bushenyi. Her strong work ethic has gotten her far, as her business currently generates 320,000 Ugandan shillings per month. The married mother of three M. began her business with her own savings and has trouble meeting the demand in the area. With this loan, she looks forward to buying more produce which will increase her sales revenue and enable her to meet her family expenses.

loans.use: purchase of more stock for resale

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya P. is married with a grown son. She runs a clothing sales business in her hometown of Novaya Kahovka. Natalya sells women’s clothing items in two local marketplaces. She has been in the trade for 17 years. Currently, her turnover capital is 17,000 Grivnyas. Her monthly net profit is about 6,000 Grivnyas.  

Natalya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional clothing merchandise for her market vending locations. Prior financial assistance has given her business a boost. The current loan will add to consistent future growth of her business.

loans.use: To increase clothing merchandise stock

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. Margarita tiene su tienda ubicada en su domicilio actividad con la que se mantiene ya que es la única que aporta al hogar que esta conformado por ella y su hija quien es madre soltera de esa manera la ayuda a la hija, la cliente trabaja hace bastante tiempo con nuestra institución demostrando responsabilidad con sus obligaciones motivo por el cual se decidió darle la tasa kiva, es un apersona responsable y muy trabajadora, con el dinero del crédito surtirá su tienda ya que le falta mercadería, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindo durante tanto tiempo.
texts.en: Margarita has her store located in her home. This store maintains her, since it is the only thing that brings money into the household. Her household is made up of her and her daughter, who is a single mother. This way, she helps her daughter. Margarita has worked with our institution for along time, demonstrating responsibility with her obligations, so she decided to put her loan on Kiva. She is a very responsible and hard-working person. With the money from this loan she will stock her store, since she needs merchandise. She is very grateful to the institution for the support that they have offered her for so long.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Natali

texts.es: Natali, de 25 años, vive en la casa de su tía, a lado de  ella y de su primo; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo.Desde hace 2 años, esta empeñosa joven se dedica al tejido de hermosos accesorios (pulseras, aretes, carteras y monederos)  en hilo; y para lograrlo se asoció con un grupo de damas de la zona por donde vive, que también se dedican a esta labor. Juntas han creado una asociación de mujeres artesanas que venden a comerciantes de la ciudad; además exportan a otros países esta mercadería. Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha por todos los logros alcanzados, ya que en la actualidad continua con su trabajo, que le gusta porque es tranquilo y puede obtener buenas ganancias. No se cansa de trabajar en este arte del tejido en hilo;  ya que puede ir de un lugar a otro, es por esta razón que para el futuro tiene planeado producir en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias, así espera progresar. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Natali tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de mercadería (en hilo de diversas variedades) que necesita para continuar produciendo, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes por cumplir.
texts.en: Natali, age 25, lives in her aunt's home with her aunt and cousin. Together they work very hard every day to get ahead. For over 2 years, this earnest youth has worked weaving beautiful accessories (bracelets, earrings, bags and wallets) from thread. In order to achieve this, she joined a group of women in her neighbourhood who also do this work. Together, they have created a group of female artists who sell to merchants in the city; furthermore, they also export this merchandise to other countries. She is very satisfied with all of their achievements, and she is continuing with her work. She likes her work because it is relaxing and she can make good earnings. She does not get tired of working in this art of woven thread since she can sell it in may different places. Thus, in the future she plans to produce in greater quantities to improve her income. This way, she hopes to progress. This is her first loan with MFP and she promises to pay her quotas punctually since she does not want to look bad to the people who are making the funding possible so that she can continue working. Natali plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a quantity of merchandise (threads of diverse varieties) that she needs to continue producing. She has various pending orders to fill.

loans.use: To purchase thread in diverse colours; she needs to fill a pending order.

loans.name: Silvia Emma

texts.es:
Silvia de 36 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), tiene una pequeña tienda. 

Ella y sus hermanos comenzaron abrir tiendas en el sector donde vivían poco a poco vieron que era rentable para ellos y las personas del sector se sentían contentos en las tiendas. Gracias a la buena administración de ellos Silvia a podido tener su propia tienda y sus propios víveres. Trabaja desde las 08h00 vendiendo detergente, lácteos, arroz, granos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, aceite, bebidas para su tienda en el futuro quiere pollos para tener una granja que quiere tener y así tener mas ingresos y asegurar la economía de sus dos hijos.
texts.en: Silvia, age 36, lives in Perimetral de Guayaquil (a periurban zone, surrounded by a salt estuary). She has a small store. She and her brother started opening stores in the sector where they live, bit by bit, and saw that it was profitable for them and that the people of the sector were happy with the stores. Thanks to their good administration, Silvia has been able to have her own store with its own food. She works from 8:00 am selling detergent, milk products, rice, and grains among others. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, oil and drinks for her store. In the future, she wants chickens for the farm that she wants, and thus to have more income and to secure the future of her two children.

loans.use: rice, oil, detergents

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional cigarettes and other provisions

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Emmanuel y se ubica en el Estado de México. Esta comunidad se distingue porque las actividades productivas que predominan en el lugar son la Agricultura, ganadería, comercio de pescado, verduras y frutas en los tianguis de la región de la zona norte del Estado de México. El grupo está conformado por 8 integrantes. La Sra. Marisol G. es integrante de este grupo. Ella es originaria de la comunidad de Emiliano Zapata, ha vivido en esta comunidad 26 años, se dedica a la elaboración y venta chicharrón, actividad que inició hace 5 años. Sus ventas las realiza en los tianguis de los alrededores de su municipio. La Sra. Marisol argumenta que últimamente su negocio se ha fortalecido gracias a los créditos, ya que juntamente con su esposo trabajan en la elaboración del producto. La Sra. Marisol tiene 26 años, estudio la primaria. Es casada y tiene 2 hijos, que en la actualidad dependen económicamente de ella y de su esposo y que gracias a su negocio los han sacado adelante. Quiere este crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio que durante los últimos 5 años le ha dado la oportunidad de mantener a su familia y de construir una casita, ya que anteriormente vivían en casa de sus suegros. Y desea que con el crédito su negocio se siga fortaleciendo. Actualmente consiguen a préstamo la materia prima para la elaboración de su chicharrón y desea que a un mediano plazo tener su propio capital para que sus ventas incrementen y así pueda surtir el chicarrón a un menor precio y obtener una mejor demanda de sus productos.
texts.en: This group is called Emmanuel and is located in Mexico State. This community is notable because its predominant productive activities are agriculture, livestock, and commerce of fish, fruits and vegetables in the street markets of the region of the northern zone of Mexico State. The group is made up of 8 members. Mrs Marisol G. is a member of this group. She is from the community of Emiliano Zapata, and has lived in this community for 26 years. She makes and sells pork rind, an activity that she started 5 years ago. She sells in the street markets surrounding her municipality. Mrs Marisol says that her business was recently strengthened thanks to loans, since now she and her husband work together making this product. Mrs Marisol is 26 and receiving her elementary education. She is married and has 2 children, who currently depend on her and her husband. Thanks to their business, they have gotten their children ahead. She wants this loan in order to continue investing in her business, which for the last 5 years has given her the opportunity to maintain her family and build a small home, since they previously lived in the home of her in-laws. She wants her business to continue to strengthen through this loan. She is currently buying the prime materials for her pork rinds on loan, and wants to soon have her own capital so that her sales can increase, and this way she will be able to stock the pork rinds at a lower price and create greater demand for her products.

loans.use: to invest in the business

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
This is 55 year-old Musu. In 1990, Musu established her firewood and building materials business. She found it to be a sustainable livelihood, allowing her to survive and support her family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 3,389,600 every month from her business.  

Having already successfully paid back a Kiva loan this month, Musu would like a new loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 in order to buy firewood and building materials. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 1,016,880. 

As Musu currently resides near the water, flooding of her home and business is a very normal occurrence during the rainy season. In the future, Musu plans to leave her current environment, which is one of the poorest communities in Freetown, and build a home in another community. She thanks you for your support.

She is married and has five children, aged 18, 26, 32, 34, and 39. She currently supports six additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and building materials to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to sell during holiday season.

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Sorie. In 1998, Sorie established his firewood and building materials business because he needed an income to support his family. Despite never having had the opportunity to attend school, Sorie is a savvy and entrepreneurial businessman: he began as a loader and eventually built his own boat in order to retrieve stock for himself. Today, Sorie has three boats and employs 18 people in his business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,211,600 every month. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000 to buy more firewood and planks. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 884,640. In the future, Sorie plans to buy a house in the center of town to avoid the flooding that frequently occurs near his current business and home during the rainy season. 

He and his wife have three children, ages five, eight, and 13. He also supports 10 additional dependents.  

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more firewood and planks for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil, groundnuts and beans

loans.name: Twetungure Women, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
Edith B.’s social nature has been at the heart of her success in the ten years she has been operating her stationery and bookbinding business in Ishaka town within the district of Bushenyi. Her experience in this business has taught her the virtue of being cordial to your clients.

Given the nature of her occupation where competition is tight, the above traits have come in handy for 56-year-old Edith. This mother of two reveals her family’s standard of living has improved ever since she began her business in which she binds books and Bibles and also makes envelopes for sale.

On a weekly basis she says she makes 60,000 UGX. With this amount she has managed to send her children to school. With this loan she says she wants to buy more bookbinding materials and expand her operations. Her future plans are to elevate her financial status through the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bookbinding materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To release the electronic goods that are waiting for him at the port

loans.name: Sop Sokhna Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOP SOKHNA DIARRA a été créé le 27 septembre 2009 au jour du financement du Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 18 femmes qui sont toutes issus du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité et par proximité. Le groupe de Solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois KEUR SERIGNE LOUGA SUD. 

Madame NDEYE M. debout à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de divers produits. Elle vend sur table des condiments tels des oignons, du piment, de l'ail, du poivre etc. 

avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroitre ses bénéfices.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The community bank named Sop Sokhna Diarra was founded on September 27, 2009.  The group is made up of 18 women that are all originally from the same village. They came together as friends and neighbors. The group is a member of the community bank Keur Serigne Louga Sud (Kiva Field Partner). 

Mrs. Ndeye M., standing to the right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 37 years old. She is married and she is the mother of 6 children. 

She has a small business through which she sells various merchandise. She sells condiments such as onions, chili peppers, garlic, pepper etc. 

With this new loan she will stock her store to better meet client demand and increase her profits.

Her goal is to help her husband in the support of the family, especially to provide health care, nutrition, and schooling to their children.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia se dedica a la venta de café, te , jugos y sándwiches en su kiosco desde hace 10 años, y esta ubicado en un lugar estratégico de la zona de Calacoto, actividad con la que mantiene a su hogar conformado por 4 hijos dos de ellos estudian en la universidad y los otros dos esta en edad escolar. También podemos indicar que la cliente es muy trabajadora y a la vez responsable con sus obligaciones, por todo lo mencionado se hizo beneficiaria del fondo kiva, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra de ladrillos y cemento para la construcción de un ambiente en su domicilio.
texts.en:
For 10 years, Sonia has been selling coffee, tea, juice and sandwiches from her kiosk, strategically located in Calacoto zone. The income from her work supports her and her 4 children. 2 of her children are in college and the other 2 are in school. 

We can also point out that the client is very hardworking and responsible for her obligations. For these reasons she merits a Kiva loan. Sonia will use the money to buy bricks and cement to build a room in her house.

loans.use: Purchase of bricks and cement.

loans.name: Justino Adolfo

texts.es: Justino Adolfo es un hombre responsable y que busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos pues él se encuentra muy emocionado con este crédito que es una oportunidad para salir adelante con su negocio. El se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de taxi, hace más de 13 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que ha buscado la forma de mejorar sus ingresos de la mejor manera posible de mantener a sus 2 hijos menores de edad y su esposa. La mayoría de sus clientes se sienten satisfecho por el servicio que ofrece. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como llantas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Justino Adolfo is a responsible man who is looking for a way to improve his income.  

He is very excited about this loan, which is his opportunity to get ahead with his business.

He has been in the business of providing taxi service for over 13 years.  He has looked for the way to improve his income in the best possible manner in order to support his two minor children and his wife.

The loan is to buy raw materials like tires, among other things.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kihihi Development Association, Kihihi Group

texts.en:
Hardworking and cordial B. Abdu is married with 6 children to take care of and knows that he has his responsibility cut out for him. This reality has been evident for the past 5 years as he has managed his business selling general merchandise, especially for home use, from the town of Kihihi. 
With his monthly earnings amounting to 240,000 UGX, he has faced long odds in providing for all his family’s needs and principally catering for his children’s welfare. Abdu wants to raise his family's living standards with this loan by improving his business. By restocking and expanding his shop, he plans to make it a wholesale business, allowing him to earn more sales revenue and pay his children's education bills.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and expand the business

loans.name: Florinda Mariel

texts.es: La señora  Florinda se dedica a la compra y venta de variedad de ropas (chamarras, poleras y otros) desde hace ocho años y medio, tiene una tienda de ropa en el mercado paga alquiler de su puesto,   Tiene casa propia, tiene dos hijos, su esposo es albañil contratista, esta en su tercer ciclo, donde ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos con la institución. El crédito lo utilizara  para aumentar su mercadería, surtir mejor su tienda con variedad de ropa de temporada, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en:
Florinda buys and sells a variety of clothing (jackets, traditional skirts, and others).  She has been doing this for eight and a half years.  She has a clothing store in the market, and she pays rent for her space.  

She has her own house, and she has two children.  Her husband is a contract bricklayer.

She is in her third cycle, and she has demonstrated herself to be responsible with her payments in the institution.  She will use the loan to increase her merchandise and stock her store with a better variety of seasonal clothes.  

She is a very hard-working person, and she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in her.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 33 años, vive en la casa de su suegra en compañía de ella y de su esposo Juan  de 30 años y de sus 2 pequeños hijos, juntos buscan que progresar cada día. Desde muy joven se acostumbró a trabajar, y cuando se junto con su pareja no dudo en continuar haciéndolo para ayudarlo en los gastos del hogar. Es por esta razón que en la actualidad se dedica a la labor de limpieza pública; y le gusta mucho este trabajo porque lo desempeña en un horario flexible que le permite atender a sus hijos; además las ganancias son considerables. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas personas menosprecian este trabajo, pero ella no le da mucha importancia pues es un trabajo honrado. Así transcurren los días de esta laboriosa mujer que ha sabido combinar a la perfección su trabajo con el rol de madre, y como siempre piensa en el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa; para atenderla en sus ratos libres, es por eso que quiere refaccionar una pieza de su casa,  de esta manera espera continuar adelante. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar con sus planes. Vilma tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita para refaccionar una pieza de su casa, pues quiere instalar un negocio de venta de comestibles.
texts.en:
Vilma is 33 years old and lives in her mother-in-law's house, together with her mother-in-law, her 30 year-old husband, Juan, and their two small children.  Each day, they seek to progress together.  She has been accustomed to working since she was very young, and when she got together with her husband, she did not doubt that she would continue doing so in order to help him with household expenses.  For this reason, she currently works in public cleaning.  She likes this job very much because it has a flexible schedule that allows her to tend to her children.  Furthermore, the earnings are considerable.  She dislikes that many people disparage this type of work, but she doesn't give those opinions much weight because it is an honorable job.  So that is how this hard-working woman passes her days, knowing how to perfectly balance her job with her role as mother.

As always, she is thinking about the future.  She plans to set up a small grocery store in her house, which she will tend in her free time.  In order to do so and to keep progressing, she wants to renovate part of her house.  This is her first loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she promises to make her repayments punctually because she does not want to look bad to the people providing the money that will make her plans possible.  Vilma plans to invest this loan in the purchase of necessary materials for renovating part of her house, so that she can set up a business selling food items.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate a space inside her house where she will set up a grocery store

loans.name: Noemí Alejandrina

texts.es:
Noemi de 64 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Cuando Noemi tenia 28 años se caso y con sus ahorros ubico una farmacia en su casa pero como no le fue bien en ese negocio decidió vender su mercadería y comprar víveres para una tienda.  Ya que no puede salir a menudo los proveedores le van a dejar los víveres a su tienda. Ella trabaja desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer vendiendo bebidas, arroz snack etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas etc. En el futuro quiere mejorar la fachada de su casa para ubicar un piso mas en su casa y dárselo a uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Noemí, aged 64, has a small store at the front of her house. She lives within the city boundaries of Guayaquil in a peri-urban area, next to the estuary of Estero Salado.

At the age of 28 Noemí got married and opened a drugstore at home. However, she was not successful in this business and decided to sell her inventory and buy groceries for her store. Since she cannot often leave her store, the suppliers deliver the groceries to her place. She works from early morning to dusk, selling drinks, rice, snacks etc.

She wants to use her loan to buy rice, sugar, canned food, drinks etc. For the future she intends to renovate the façade of her house and add another floor to her house which she will give to one of her children.

loans.use: To buy rice, drinks and snacks

loans.name: Kyabugimbi Intergrated, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
B. Eldard, a hardworking, determined, married father of 7 children, has been operating a butcher shop and, as a side line, a mechanical shop for over 20 years in Kyabugimbi Trading Centre, Bushenyi. Due to his ambition to become a financially sound businessman, he borrowed money from a financial institution and used his savings from a previous farming business to join his friends, who introduced him to his butchery business. 
He is requesting this loan to purchase tools for his mechanical business and to stock more goats for slaughtering to earn more profit. He says this will enable him to pay his family's bills and educate all his children.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his mechanical shop and goats for his butcher shop

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: Benjamin, es un hombre sabio y dedicado a su familia, adora a sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con su esposa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Cachunayo. En todo este tiempo se siente orgulloso de los logros alcanzados, ya que sus nietos que ya son todos universitarios. En tanto él se dedica a trabajar en una minera, de la que hoy solo obtiene una pequeña pensión, además obtiene productos como el maíz y papa que cultiva y que los vende en el mercado central de su localidad, eso lo ayuda también es su economía. Le gusta mucho el campo y a tantos años de esfuerzos y sacrificios, desde continuar dedicándose a la agricultura. En adelante desea obtener una pequeña estancia, donde se dedicará a la crianza de cuyes. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece todo este tiempo a su banco comunal, que le apoyo en el logro de sus objetivos. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono para su cultivo de maíz, que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en:
Benjamin is wise and dedicated to his family.  He loves his four children but only he and his wife live in their home in Cachunayo.  He is proud of what he has achieved over time, especially now that all of his grandchildren are attending university.

He works in mining, but he only receives a small pension now.  He also obtains products such as corn and potatoes that he grows and sells in his neighborhood’s central market.  This also helps him financially.

He likes the field very much after so many years of hard work and sacrifice while farming.  In the future he wants to obtain a small dwelling where he can raise Guinea pigs.

This will be his 10th loan through MFP and he is grateful to his communal bank that has offered him support and helped him to reach his goals.  He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizer for his corn crop, which he will be harvesting soon.

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Buloba Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: Hardworking and determined N. Danata, a 50-year-old single mother of 8, has for the last 10 years been in a cattle and milk sales business in Buloba-Lugazi. N. began with a farming business. She also has a small pharmacy. In a month, her profits total up to 800,000 UGX. She is requesting this loan to revitalize her business with the purchase of milk containers. N.’s affiliation is with the Buloba Development Group-Lugazi.

loans.use: to purchase milk containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Kisoboka Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: For the last 6 years, N. Mary, a 35-year-old mother of 3, has kept a level head in the face of financial challenges to keep her herbal natural medicine business afloat. Her business, located in Kisoga-Mukono, was started with support from her husband. Prior to that, Mary was involved in selling poultry. She earns up to 200,000 UGX in weekly profits. She attributes her success to her self-determination and relentless hard work. Mary says she will use this loan to purchase more containers to package her herbal medicines. Mary is affliated with Kisoboka Development Group-Mukono.

loans.use: to purchase more containers to package her herbal natural medicines

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en: Monique is 29 years old and married to a farmer. They have 4 children between the ages of 2  and 10 . Two of them go to school while the other two are still young. She has also adopted one child whom she helps. Monique is the group leader of the ABADAHEMUKA Group. Monique sells sorghum. She has spent 3 years in this business of selling sorghum. With this loan she will buy more sorghum to sell. With the  profit from this business she will increase the amount of sorghum and save money. She would like to set up her own strong business where everyone can know her better than the way she is known now. In the photo, Monique is sitting at the front row with a blue notebook.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell

loans.name: Damasco

texts.es:
El señor Damasco Z. tiene 62 años de edad, está casado con la señora Juana Medina, juntos tienen 2 hijos ya todos mayores.
Se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 30 años, empezó trabajando en construcciones en una empresa de obras en la capital de la Argentina, ya que no habiendo nada que hacer por la zona en donde el vivía, tuvo que rebuscarse en otro país para poder salir adelante, después de 15 años regreso a Paraguaya, fue ahí donde le conoció a la que iba a ser su esposa, la señora Juana, inmediatamente ya se casaron y tuvieron hijos.  

Hasta el momento sigue trabajando en las construcciones, profesión que había aprendido fuera del país, el  préstamo solicitado es para la compra una mezcladora ya que esa herramienta es imprescindible para éste trabajo.
Agradece mucho a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Sr. Damasco Z. is 62 years old and married. His wife's name is Juana Medina, and they have two adult children.

Damasco has been working in construction for more than 30 years. He started out with a construction company in the capital of Argentina as there was no work in the area where he was living. He had to move to another country in order to make any progress in life. After 15 years he returned to Paraguay where he met his future wife, Sra. Juana. They got married straightaway and had children.

Damasco is still working in construction, a job he learned to do outside the country. He plans to use the loan to buy a cement mixer as it is an indispensable tool for the work he does.

He is very grateful to Kiva partner, Fundación Paraguaya, for the loan.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.en:
Bartolo is a 55-year-old pepper producer and father of nine who lives alone in the region of Upala in the Northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Bartolo is a dedicated farmer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. He works to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land he works is his own. In addition to his agricultural activity, Bartolo feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Bartolo lives is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Bartolo is working hard striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Bartolo and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne and Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Bartolo. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Bartolo planted his peppers four months ago and will expect to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Bartolo and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Bartolo, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve living conditions for Bartolo as well as the community at large. Above all, Bartolo wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. He wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es: Armando, de 48 años, es un hombre sabio y trabajador, esta casado con Esperanza, de 46 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos; pero solo viven con dos de ellos, Jonathan de 23 y Jens de 8 años, en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Huaracayo. Él vive en un pequeño paraje a las afueras de la ciudad de Tarma; ahí se ubica su acogedora casa, donde todos los días se dirige muy contento a cuidar de sus terrenos de cultivo. Hace ya 20 años que se inicia en la labor más sacrificada y noble, “la agricultura”; aquí aprendió a cultivar una variedad de hortalizas y maíz; que son el alimento primordial en todo el país y las amas de casa lo consumen a diario. Por ello Armando comenzó a vender sus cosechas a la capital del país; donde hay más demanda y mayores compradores; con ello quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida,”con la educación que se merecen”, menciona. Para su futuro quiere sembrar en mayores cantidades y poder abastecer a las grandes empresas que se dedican a la venta de alimentos. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y como miembro de su banco comunal, se siente satisfecho de poder aportar en el desarrollo y ahorro de su asociación. Con el crédito que obtendrá, piensa comprar abono para sus 25 tongos de maíz, que equivale a toda la extensión de terrenos de cultivo que posee.
texts.en:
48-year old Armando is a wise and hardworking man. He is married to 46-year old Esperanza, and they have four children. Only two of them still live at home, 23-year old Jonathan and 8-year old Jens. They have their own house in the village of Huaracayo, a little place on the outskirts of Tarma. Everyday Armando leaves his cosy house and happily sets off to work in his fields. He's been a farmer for twenty years and considers it demanding yet noble work. He has learned how to grow a variety of vegetables and maize, very important crops throughout the country and eaten on a daily basis.

Armando sells his produce in the capital city where there is more demand and more buyers. With the money he earns he wants to help his children attain a better quality of life and 'have the education that they deserve.' In the future he wishes to plant larger quantities so that he can supply the large businesses that sell food. 

This is his tenth loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and as a member of his community bank, Armando is satisfied to be able to contribute to the development and savings of his association. With this loan he plans to buy fertilizer for all his maize fields.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Cleotilde Del Socorro

texts.es: Cleotilde tiene su actividad que es ofrecer el servicio de costura. Hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con créditos por lo que han sido muy satisfactorios. Ella es una persona muy tranquila y dinámica pues siempre está buscando la forma de mantener a su familia ella ofrece muy buena calidad de sus productos y a sus clientes eso les gusta. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como tijeras, telas, agujas entre otras. Por lo que sueña con establecer su negocio aun más.
texts.en:
Cleotilde earns her living as a seamstress. She's had her business for more than 12 years.

This is not her first experience with loans and she has been very satisfied with them. She is a very calm yet active person who is always seeking ways to better the life of her family.

Cleotilde makes very good quality products which her customers really like. This loan will be used to buy basic supplies like scissors, fabric, needles etc. Her dream is to make her business even better.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a 38-year-old mother and pepper producer who lives with her family in the region of Upala in the Northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Lorena is a dedicated producer and mother. She plans to focus her efforts on the planting and harvesting of Habanero peppers. She works in cooperation with her family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land she works is her own. In addition to her agricultural activity, Lorena feels it is important to be an active member of her community. As a result, she dedicates a significant portion of her time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Lorena and her family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Lorena is working hard towards the sustenance of her family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from her land as well as her labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Lorena and her family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Lorena with the help of her family members in the region of Upala. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Lorena expects to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, she dedicates the hours from 7AM to 4PM everyday to her agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Lorena and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Lorena, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Lorena wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia started her own business when she was 50 years old. She sells cosmetics and small home products at the open market. She has a booth that can be closed up and locked so that she does not need to take her inventory back and forth every day as she used to do in the past.

Lidia is 61 years old and divorced, and she lives with her son and his family. Lidia's goal is to help her son's family financially and help to improve their living conditions. 

Lidia has used micro-loans before and found them very instrumental for her business. This time she would like to borrow 14,700 Grivnas to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nila Lourde

texts.en:
NiL., age 58, raises animals at the back of the family home, allowing her to earn additional income for the family. She tends many kinds of animals, including goats, turkeys, ducks, and guinea pigs. These she sells in the markets in both the city of Lambayeque and the city of Chiclayo. In addition to raising animals, NiL. brews chicha (a traditional beverage which is consumed by the local workers and is prized during festivals) and maintains a small garden. She lives with her husband and daughter in their own home in the village of Hacienda Vieja in the district of Tucume.

NiL. is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional feed for her animals and to expand her gardening operation.  She hopes to be able to maintain and raise her animals until the holiday season, when she will be able to sell them at a premium. She dreams of providing an education for her daughter and making improvements to her home.

This will be NiL.’s first loan with our institution and she has no previous experience with financial institutions. She is a well-respected member of her community and our review of her family income indicates that it is stable and sufficient.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for her animals and to expand her gardening operation

loans.name: Edith Ismelda

texts.es:
La Sra Edith B. de Guerrero  tiene 47 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos, 3 menores  y 2 mayores de edad. 
Ella se dedica a la confecciones de ropas hace más de 21 años, empezó trabajando con su madrina, la cual se dedica a este rubro desde hace ya más de 40 años.
 Luego de tener suficiente experiencia  tomo la decisión de abrir su propio negocio empezó con una pequeña maquina a pedal, luego con el tiempo pudo comprar  una maquina industrial que le ayudo a incrementar  el trabajo  y a la vez conseguir nuevos clientes.

El préstamo solicitado es para  la compra de telas  para  confeccionar uniformes, conjuntos deportivos para colegios y así poder venderlos e incrementar sus ingresos, actualmente tiene muchos pedidos de buzos, remeras y uniformes.
 
Agradece  mucho a la Fundación Paraguaya  por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Edith B. de Guerrero is 47 years old and has 5 children, 3 minors and 2 adults.

She has worked making clothing for the last 21 years.  She started working with her godmother who had worked in this for 40 years.

After gaining enough experience, she decided to open her own business.  She started with a small pedal sewing machine and was later able to buy an industrial machine which helped her to increase her work and gain new customers.

She is seeking a loan to buy fabric to make uniforms and athletic wear for schools which will help her to increase her sales; she currently has many orders for sweatshirts, t-shirts and uniforms.

She is very grateful to the Fundacion Paraguaya for the loan she will receive.

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Arbildo

texts.en:
Arbilido, age 29, earns his living by driving a motor taxi and raising animals in his back yard. He has been involved in these activities for the last five years and is known in the area as a responsible service provider. His wife works in a chicken factory in the city of Lambayeque and earns a stable salary. They live with their two children outside of the city of Lambayeque, in an industrial zone called Mocce Antiguo.

Arbilido is requesting this loan in order to purchase more animals and additional feed as well as to repair his corrals. He hopes to be able to raise the new animals to the point where he can sell them at good prices when the holiday season arrives.

Arbilido is a dedicated worker and an innately happy person. He and his wife are devoted parents who strive every day to create a better life for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more animals and additional feed as well as to repair his corrals

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 46 años, es una mujer alegre y sacrificada, tiene un hijo, pero vive sola en la comunidad de Huaracayo. Los años de dedicación y servicio hacía su hijo le enseñaron, que no hay mejor recompensa en la vida que verlos salir adelante. Hace ya 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz y arveja; los que después de cuidarlos los lleva al mercado central de la capital, donde los vende al por mayor.  Pero ahora ella quiere abrir una pequeña ferretería, en la zona central de su ciudad de Tarma, porqué sabe muy bien que sus fuerzas ya no son las mismas, se siente sola y desea estar junto a su hijo, que vive en la ciudad. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esta muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal que es muy respetado en su localidad; con el que está segura podrá lograr sus objetivo. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono y contratará operarios para que la ayuden en la cosecha.
texts.en: Yolanda is 46 years old and is a very happy and hard-working woman.  She has one son but she lives alone in the community of Huaracayo.  The years of dedication and service she spent raising her son taught her that there is no better reward in life than seeing your children progress.  Ten years ago, she began to work in agriculture, raising corn and peas.  After growing them, she takes them to the central market in the capital where she sells them wholesale.  Now, she would like to open a small hardware store in the central area of her native city of Tarma, because she understands that she does not have the strength that she used to; she feels alone and wants to be close to her son who lives in the city.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is very happy to belong to a village bank that is very well-respected in her neighborhood.  She knows that with the help of the bank, she will be able to achieve her goal.  With the loan, she will purchase fertilizer and contract workers to help her with the harvest.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and pay the day-laborers who help with the harvest

loans.name: Santos Domingo

texts.en:
Santos, age 63, and his wife operate three businesses out of their home. They run a small grocery store out of the front of their home and they raise animals in the back yard. Additionally, Santos sells milk to his neighbors, both out of the grocery store and door to door. The two work night and day in order to maintain their business and continue to better their lives. They reside in their own home in the village of Tranea Farupe, which lies near Morrope, a traditionally rural area with many farmers.

The loan proceeds are destined to be used for the purchase of additional feed for the animals and to fund other agricultural activities. Santos hopes that he will be able to raise his animals to the appropriate size and weight by Christmastime in order to sell them at the higher holiday prices. 

Santos has a credit history with our institution and has always paid punctually. We have approved his current request based on the stable income his family exhibits and the good payment history he has developed.

loans.use: To buy additional feed for the animals and to fund other agricultural activities

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es: Jaqueline, de 29 años, es una mujer luchadora y buena, es madre soltera y adora a su hija Yusbeth de 9 años, juntas viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Hace ya 10 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura; donde siembra papa y arveja, los que posteriormente vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Como mujer emprendedora y capaz, ha decidido expandirse más, pues su hija esta creciendo y necesita mayores cuidados y dedicaciones, fue entonces que con el poco dinero ahorrado compró un pequeño puesto en el mercado de su localidad, ahí vende papa y hortalizas a los pobladores que todos los días compra para el almuerzo de casa. En adelante ella está pensando comprar más terrenos de cultivo en los cuales podrá sembrar mayor cantidad de papa, de esa manera podrá comercializar en la capital de su país. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a un grupo comunal, donde está segura podrá salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar más cantidad de semillas de papa.
texts.en: Jaqueline is 29 years old and is a very good, hard-working woman.  She is a single mother who adores her 9 year old daughter Yusbeth.  They live together in their own home located in the city of Chiras.  Ten years ago, she started working in agriculture growing potatoes and peas which she sells in the city's central market.  As a capable, enterprising woman, she has decided to expand her business now that her daughter is growing and needs more of her time.  She took the small amount of money she saved and bought a small stand in the local market.  She sells potatoes and vegetables to the locals who come to buy food for their lunches everyday.  In the future, she would like to buy more land to grow more potatoes which she could sell in the country's capital.  This is her first loan through MFP and she is very grateful to belong to the village bank which she is sure will help her move forward.  She will use the loan to buy more potato seeds.

loans.use: Comprar semillas de papa.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ana; ella tiene 59 años de edad y es divorciada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa y perfumes, ella vende en forma independiente ofreciendo a las diferentes instituciones y al público en general por medio de este negocio independiente saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para que pueda vender los perfumes y ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, vestidos, blusas y perfumes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ana belongs to the Senor de Muruhuay village bank which is located in the district of Cusco in the Cusco province of Cusco, Peru.

Ana is 59 years old and is divorced with 2 children.  She balances her daily chores with her business selling clothes and perfumes.  She sells independently offering her goods to different institutions and to the general public; she uses her business to support her children.  She would like to have a store where she can sell her perfumes and clothes.  She is seeking a loan to buy clothes including pants, dresses, blouses, and perfumes.

She is grateful to those who help her to realize her dream through this loan and she promises to be punctual in her repayments of the loan.

loans.use: Purchase pants, dresses, blouses and perfumes

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old. She lives with her son in the village of Sasape Viejo in Tucume, a traditionally rural district where many residents raise animals for a living.

Maria is a seamstress. She has been operating a small business out of her home for the last twenty years, providing individual tailoring and repair services to her neighbors and friends. She also sews commercial clothing which she sells to the local markets.

Maria is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional fabric and other supplies so that she can expand her offerings and meet her clientele's demands. She hopes that she will be able to make a bulk purchase in order to increase her profit margin and subsequently improve her family’s well being.

Maria doesn’t have any other outstanding loans. She is well recommended by her friends and neighbors. She is a very hardworking and dedicated woman.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric and other supplies so that she can expand her offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is 25 years old and has two children. They live in their own home in the Anexo San Jose in the village of La Cedoroda in the district of Morrope.

Silvia sells fruit and candy in the mornings in her village and the surrounding area. She purchases inventory on a regular basis from the Mercado Moshoqueque, which is a sprawling wholesale market located in the northern portion of the city of Chiclayo. Her sales vary with the season, selling various fruits as they come into season.

The requested loan is designated for the purchase of additional merchandise so that she can expand the selection she offers to her clients. She also expects to be able to realize greater discounts because she will buy non-perishable items in bulk.

Silvia is a woman who is devoted to her family, and her neighbors think highly of her. This will be Silvia’s first loan and first experience with a financial institution. She hopes to be able to use the credit to improve her family’s quality of life and help provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruit and candy

loans.name: Assiba

texts.fr: assiba est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois, sa clientèle se compose des femmes de son quartier qui utilisent le sac de charbons de bois pour faire la cuisine. le crédit qu'elle sollicite va lui permettre d'acheter le sac de charbons de bois et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville d'Afagnan. elle s'est lancée dans ce commerce depuis plus de 10 ans.
texts.en: Assiba is married and the mother of two children. As an income-producing activity, she buys and sells sacks of charcoal. Her customers are women from her neighborhood who use the charcoal to cook.  The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy sacks of charcoal and meet her customers' needs.  Assiba gets her supplies in the town of Afagnan, in the interior of the country, and has been involved in this activity for ten years.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Rafatou

texts.fr: rafatou exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle a commencé ce commerce en 1998. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a remboursé sans difficulté. elle sollicite actuellement de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de piles, 3 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 5 paniers moyens de tomates et divers produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en: As an income-producing activity, Rafatou is a general grocery retailer, having started out in this business in 1998. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé, and her clientèle is made up of all types of people. Raftaou has already obtained a loan from WAGES, which she repaid without any problems. She is now requesting a second loan to buy two cartons of batteries, three cartons of pasta, five medium-sized baskets of tomatoes and various general grocery products. She is married and the mother of two children.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: afi est une jeune fille célibataire. a la fin de son apprentissage, n'ayant pas les moyens d'ouvrir un salon de coiffure. elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques. elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans cette activité. sa clientèle est en majorité féminine. elle veut augmenter son stock pour pouvoir répondre aux besoisn de fin d'année de sa clientèle. elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 50 mèches, 50 tissages, et divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en: Afi A. is a young unmarried woman. At the end of her apprenticeship, she could not afford to open a hair salon. She started in the business of cosmetic  sales. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Her clientele is predominantly female. She wants to increase her stock to meet the year-end needs of her customers. She is requesting a loan to buy 50 hair extensions, 50 hair weaves, and various cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: amévi s'est lancée en 2005 dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques, elle exerce son activité dans sa boutique qu'elle a appelé" LA CITE DES BELLES FILLES". elle n'a jamais obtenu du crédit de WAGES. actuellement pour faire face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits esthétiques 2 cartons de mèches, 4 cartons de crèmes "FIT Fé", 2 cartons de déodorants de diverses marques et divers autres produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Amévi started to sell cosmetic products in 2005. She has a shop called “La cité des belles filles” (city of beautiful girls). She never contracted a loan from WAGES until now.

Her stocks are currently depleted and she is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy various beauty products, two boxes of hair extensions, four boxes of “FIT Fé" lotions, two boxes of deodorants from selected brands, and various other cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Domidia

texts.en:
Domidia is a 45-year-old pepper producer and mother of five who lives with her family in the region of Upala in the Northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Domidia is a dedicated producer and mother. She plans to focus her efforts on the planting and harvesting of Cayenne peppers. She works in cooperation with her family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land she works is her own. In addition to her agricultural activity, Domidia feels it is important to be an active member of her community. As a result, she dedicates a significant portion of her time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Domidia and her family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Domidia is working hard towards the sustenance of her family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from her land as well as her labor. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Domidia and her family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Domidia with the help of her family members in the region of Upala. The production cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Domidia expects to harvest in the next eight months. Typically, she dedicates the hours from 7AM to 4PM everyday to her agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial (PROPICA) is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Domidia and other producers in the Upala community face, is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Domidia, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Domidia wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented. She wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her home and neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural chemicals and nutrients.

loans.name: Yessica Patricia

texts.es:
Yessenia de 36 años, tiene una pequeña papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas). 

Inicio su negocio hace tres años atrás desde que su mama con uno de sus hermanos le comenzaron a enviar dinero del extranjero  para invertir en una papelería. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ha podido incrementar su pequeña papelería. Por un tumor que tenia paralizo un poco sus ventas hace dos años pero ya esta recuperada y lista para tener su papelería bien surtida. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una copiadora para dar otros servicios a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere incrementar la papelería y dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
