Yessenia is 36 years old and runs a small paper store in the front part of her home; she lives in Paraiso de Guayaquil (a semi-urban area with dirt streets and houses situated in the mountains).

She started her business 3 years ago when her mother and one of her brothers started sending her money from abroad to invest in the store.  Little by little, she has been able to grow her small paper store.  She had a tumor 2 years ago which slowed her ability to grow the business but now she has recovered and is ready to stock her store.

She will use the loan to buy a copier to provide other services to her customers.  In the future, she would like to grow the paper store and give great service to her clients.

loans.use: Copiers

loans.name: Katima Chantal

texts.fr: chantal est une femme de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'agoè logopé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. elle fait ce commerce depuis 2002. la pluie  a rendu inutilisable une grande partie de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 40 sacs de charbons de bois. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays, dans la ville d'anié.
texts.en: Chantal is a 33-year old woman, married and the mother of three. She lives with her family in  Agoè Logopé, one of the peripheral districts of the city of Lomé. She makes al living by selling charcoal. She has been in this business since 2002.  A large part of her stock has been spoiled by rain. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase 40 bags of charcoal. She stocks up in the interior part of the country, in Anié.

loans.use: Purchasing charcoal

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: essohanam est une femme très dynamique, elle a 36 ans et est mariée avec 3 enfants. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. elle a une ancienneté de 11 ans dans ce commerce. elle s'approvisionne dans les marchés locaux de lomé. le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne peut satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle. elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de 36 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en: Essohanam N. is a very energetic woman, She is 36 years and is married with 3 children. Her income-generating business is selling bags of charcoal. She has 11 years of experience in this business. She gets her supplies in Lomé's local markets. Her currently available stock cannot meet the needs of her customers. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES to purchase 36 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Fouléra

texts.fr: fouléra est une femme de 37 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d'adéwi à lomé. En 1990 elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle exerce son commerce dans une boutique à la devanture de sa maison. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. en prévision à la demande de sa clientèle qui va s'accentuer compte tenue de l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s'approvisionner avec 8 cartons de lait, 5 cartons de sucre, 10 sacs moyen de riz et divers autres produits alimentaires.
texts.en: Fouléra is 37 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the Adéwi neighborhood of Lomé. In 1990 she started a business selling grocery products. She does business in a shop in the front of her home. Her customers come from diverse backgrounds. Anticipating her customers' increasing demand due to the approaching holiday season, she is seeking a loan through WAGES in order to stock up with 8 cartons of milk, 5 cartons of sugar, 10 medium bags of rice, and various other grocery products.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: yaovi est un homme de 41 ans, il est marié et père de 3 enfants. il a ouvert un bar qu'il a appelé" FESTIVAL", les fêtes de fin d'année approchent et il voudrait mettre tous les atouts de son côté, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 3 casiers de boissons. avec le reste du crédit il compte réparer son congélateur qui est panne. il s'approvisionne auprès de la brasserie de Lomé.
texts.en: Yaovi is a 41-year old man, married and the father of three. He has opened a bar  and named “FESTIVAL.” He would like to be fully ready for the approaching New Year festivities. He is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase three cases of beverages. He plans to use the rest of his loan to repair his broken refrigerator. He purchases his goods from a restaurant in Lomé.

loans.use: Purchasing cases of beverages

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr: en 2000, chérifatou s'est lancé dans la vente de produits cosmétiques, elle dresse son étalage de marchandises à la devanture de sa maison pour attirer le regard des passants. elle fait face en ce moment à une rupture de stock raison pour laquelle elle sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits cosmétiques, avec le reste u crédit elle voudrait commencer aussi la vente de chaussures de sortie pour femme. elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
texts.en: In 2000, Chérifatou launched a business selling cosmetic products. She displays her wares at a stand in front of her home in order to attract the attention of people passing by. At present, she has run out of stock, which is why she is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase a variety of cosmetic products. She would like to use the rest of the loan to start selling special-occasion shoes for women. She is married and the mother of four.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics

loans.name: Esmeraldas De San Francisco Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Esmeraldas D. San Francisco el grupo eligió el nombre por ser un piedra muy bonita y es una manera D. motivación pues se consideran personas muy valiosas para cada una D. sus familias. 
Está ubicado en Atlacomulco, México, es una comunidad que se distingue por ser muy responsables y D. calidad moral, además es un grupo muy consciente D. los constantes cambios en la economía y siempre solicitan lo que pueden pagar. La Sra. Andrea E. es una integrante del grupo D. 41 años, es casada y tiene un hijo D. 10 años. Ella estudió hasta la primaria, comenta que desafortunadamente no pudo seguir estudiando por la responsabilidad que adquirió en su casa y con su familia, actualmente se dedica a la costura y a la venta D. plástico, realiza costuras D. muy buena calidad que es el producto que más resalta D. lo que venD., dado que muy pocas personas se dedican a realizar este tipo D. trabajos por el tiempo que lleva realizarlos, a pesar D. ello a la señora Andrea le gusta mucho su trabajo y considera que eso es el fundamento que le permite vender dia a dia y salir a adelante.
El fin que tiene la señora al solicitar el crédito es lograr poco a poco hacer crecer su negocio, y del ingreso que D. allí obtenga lograr que su hijo termine los estudios, puesto que ella no pudo estudiar por las carencias que vivió.
texts.en:
This group is named "Esmeraldas of San Francisco" (San Francisco Emeralds). The group chose the name since it's a very beautiful stone and it is motivating since they're considered valuable people for each of their families.

The group is located in Atlacomulco, Mexico. It is a community that is distinguished by being very responsible and of moral quality. Additionally, it is a  group that is very aware of the constant changing nature of the economy and they always request what they can repay. Andrea E. is one of the members of the group. She is 41 years old, is married and has a 10 year old son. She finished elementary school, but notes that, unfortunately, she couldn't continue her education because of the responsibility she acquired in her home and with her family. Currently, she is dedicated to sewing and selling plastic items. Her sewing is very good quality and is the product that stands out most from everything she sells due to the fact that few people are dedicated to this type of work because of the time required. Despite this, Andrea likes her work and considers it to be the foundation for her to sell day after day and get ahead.

Andrea's goal in requesting this loan is to gradually grow her business and, from the income she obtains, to help her son finish his education since she was never able to do so due to the shortcomings of her life.

loans.use: To grow their business.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
El Sr. Freddy es soltero, vive en casa familiar ya que no posee casa, en una de las compañía de Caacupe.
El es un hombre muy trabajador y lograr creae para su micro empresa que es la producción de ladrillos común.
Esto los realiza con la ayuda de colaboradores, (empleados), y solicita a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva un crédito para la compra de arcillas, materia prima principal para su producción, teniendo este en cantidades la producción es segura y por ende el ingreso también está asegurado durante todo los meses.
texts.en:
Sr. Freddy is single. Since he doesn’t have his own house he lives in his family home in the community of Caacupe.

He is a very hardworking man, and has succeeded in creating his small business producing bricks. He has accomplished this with the help of employees and is applying to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for a loan for the purchase of clay, the main raw material for his product. Having this in quantity will assure production and also assure that he has income throughout the year.

loans.use: In order to purchase raw material for production (clay for manufacturing bricks).

loans.name: Maria Juanita

texts.es:
María de 45 años, tiene una peluquería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Ella trabajo en una peluquería cuando era joven poco a poco le fue gustando la actividad hasta que se caso y tubo que solventar algunos gastos de su familia. Compro algunos instrumento de belleza e inicio con su negocio. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 09h00am hasta las 20h00pm haciendo cortes de cabello y peinados. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  cemento, pinturas, piedras para construir mejor su peluquería y casa. En el futuro quiere irse a otro sector para tener mas ingresos con su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and owns a beauty salon in the space behind her house. She lives in the perimeter of Guayaquil (a suburban zone around the saltwater estuary).

She has worked in a salon since she was young. Gradually, she came to like this work since she married and had to help with her family's bills. She bought some beauty instruments and started her business. Currently, she works from 9AM until 8PM, cutting and styling hair.

With the loan, she wishes to buy cement, paint, and stone to improve her salon and house. In the future, she wishes to move to another area to have better income with her business.

loans.use: Cement, stone and sand.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma, de 20 años, es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, convive con Ángel de 28 años, producto de su amor tuvieron a Ruth de 3 añitos, los tres viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Ella se dedica 8 años a la agricultura, le gusta mucho cuidar la tierra y poder cultivarla, como también pasar el tiempo con su esposo, que le ayuda a cuidar y arar la tierra. Los productos que siembra son papa y arveja, los que después comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad. Pero no solo a ello se dedica Irma, también cría vacas y toros; es por ello que más adelante desea abrir una estancia, donde podrá criar ganados de calidad y obtendrá la mejor leche y queso de la región, de la misma manera quiere construir su casa propia donde podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está feliz de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde está segura podrá crecer más. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará remedios para su cultivo de papa; asimismo invertirá para contratar operarios que le ayudarán a cosechará su sembrío.
texts.en: Irma, who is 20, is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family. She lives with Ángel, who is 28 years old. As a product of their love, they had Ruth who is 3 years old. The three of them live in a rented house located in the Chiras area. She has been dedicated for 8 years to farming. She likes to care for the land and be able to cultivate it, as well as spend time with her husband, who helps her care for and plow the land. The products that they sow are potatoes and peas, which they later sell in the central market in their city. But this is not all. Irma also raises cattle and bulls, a result of which Irma wishes to open a ranch in the future where she would be able to raise quality cattle and produce the best milk and cheese in the region. She also wishes to construct her own house where she could give a better quality of life to her family. This is her first loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to her community bank where she is sure she'll be able to grow more. With the loan that she will obtain, she will buy remedies for her potato crop. Additionally, she will invest in hiring workers who will help harvest her crop.

loans.use: Buy remedies to take care of her potato crop as well as hire workers to help her with the harvest.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La  señora Carmen A. es casada y vive en la compañía Tacuati D. la ciudad D. atyra.

La  señora Carmen es comerciante, se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. termos forrados en cuero y cuerinas.

Al inicio D. su actividad ellos solo Fabricaban  zapatillas D. cuero y el problema era que durante el verano tenían mucho trabajo, pero en invierno no trabajaban,  porque  no había ventas.
 Luego viendo varias alternativas D. trabajos con varias personas que se dedicaban  a esta actividad, lanzaron un nuevo producto al  mercado que fueron los termos forrados en cuero que fue muy bien aceptado por  el público.

Actualmente tiene 4 personas trabajando en su local y cada día tienen más pedidos y en verano preparan termos para agua fría y en invierno termos para agua caliente.

Doña Carmen agradece por el credito, a la Fundación Paraguaya  ya que para ella es un apoyo en su actividad y mediante ello, podrá satisfacer los pedidos para las  fiestas que se avecinan, brindando un producto D. buena calidad a la comunidad y a la vez aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen A. is married and lives in Tacuati in the city of Atyra. She is a vendor, dedicated to making and selling thermoses lined in leather and leatherette.

When she started this activity, they only maD. leather slippers and the problem was that in the summer, they had a lot of work, but in the winter they had not work because they didn't have sales. Then, seeing various alternatives for work with multiple people dedicated to this work, they launched a new product in the market that was the thermos lined in leather that was well accepted by the public.

Currently, she has four people working in her shop and every day they have more orders and in the summer they create thermoses for cold water and in the winter thermoses for hot water.

Carmen is thankful to Fundación  Paraguaya for the loan since, for her, it is support for her work and, through it, she will be able to satisfy the orders for the festivities that are approaching providing a good quality product to the community and at the same time increasing her income.

loans.use: Acquire materials to make artisanal thermoses such as: thermoses, leather, thread, paint, decorative accessories

loans.name: Zoraida Genoveva

texts.es:
Zoraida de 60 años, es estilista y peluquera personal, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado). 

Hace 30 años atrás ella trabajaba en un salón de belleza pero como quería independizarse y tener su propio dinero. Invirtió sus ahorros en productos de uso para una estilista y así fue cuando promociono sus servicios de estilista a sus vecinos y conocidos, poco a poco con esfuerzo y paciencia pudo tener una clientela fija. En la actualidad ella hace peinados, maquilla y corta cabello a domicilio. 

Con el pre4stamo quiere comprar zinc, cemento, arena para poder construir su casa y ubicar ya su negocio propio. En el futuro quiere tener su propio salón de belleza y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Zoraida is 60 years old and is a stylist and personal hairdresser.  She lives just outside of Guayaquil (a semiurban area, in the environs of a salty estuary).

Zoraida worked in a beauty salon for thirty years, but she wanted to become independent and make her own money.  She invested her savings in stylist products and advertised her services to neighbors and acquaintances.  Little by little, with effort and patience, she acquired a fixed clientele.  Today Zoraida does hairstyling, makeup, and haircuts from her home.

With the loan proceeds, she will purchase zinc, cement and sand for construction of a home in which she will locate her business.  In the future, she would like to have her own beauty salon and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: To purchase zinc, cement and sand.

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel, de 25 años, es un hombre apuesto y trabajador, que se dedica al bienestar de su familia, vive con sus padres Manuel de 75 y Alejandría de 63 años; en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huaracayo. Hace tres años que se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, negocio que le resulta muy rentable, es así que cada semana viaja a la capital; ahí negocia la cosecha de maíz que posee y lo comercializa a los agricultores de su zona. Pero como buen hijo, Abel práctica lo que le enseñaron sus padres, que es la siembra de maíz y arveja, ya que desde niño aprendió a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella.  Ahora él desea dedicarse al trasporte de mercadería de ciudad en ciudad; ayudando a los microempresarios a trasladar sus productos por todo el país; para ello está juntando una suma considerable de dinero para poder comprarse su propio camión y tener mayor rentabilidad. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, ahora puede invertir sin obstáculos, sabe que con ello obtendrá mayores ganancias y agradece a su banco comunal por el apoyo que le brinda. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará varios sacos de abono y fertilizantes, con ello cuidará el maíz que está sembrando, ya que muy pronto cosechará este grano.
texts.en: Abel, age 25, is a handsome and hard-working man who is dedicated to the well-being of his family. He lives with his parents, Manuel, age 75, and Alejandría, age 63, in their own house located in the town of Huaracayo. For the past three years, he has worked buying and selling corn, a business which has been quite profitable for him. For this work, he travels to the capital every week; there, he negotiates the sale of his own corn harvest and that which he is selling for the farmers of his area. But like a good son, Abel also practices what his parents taught him, which is growing corn and peas, since he learned from childhood how to work the soil and live from it. Now his desire is to work transporting merchandise from city to city, helping microentrepreneurs to distribute their products throughout the country. For this purpose, he is saving up a considerable sum of money so that he can buy his own truck and achieve greater profitability. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and now he can invest without obstacles. He knows that with this he will obtain greater earnings, and he is grateful to his communal bank for the support it has provided to him. With the loan he will obtain, he will buy numerous sacks of compost and fertilizer, which he will use on the corn he is growing, since very soon it will be time to harvest this crop.

loans.use: Buying sacks of fertilizer for his corn crops

loans.name: Mardonia

texts.es: Mardonia, de 37 años, es una mujer joven y soltera, que se dedica integralmente a su trabajo, ella vive en su casa propia ubicada en el pueblo de Chachunayo. A pesar de su edad, Mardonia no se amilana por no tener una familia a su lado y como mujer moderna, piensa progresar y salir adelante sin la ayuda de nadie; porqué sabe muy bien que el esfuerzo proviene de muchos sacrificios. Desde niña le enseñaron a cultivar los terrenos de cultivo, ahora ella posee un terreno propio, ahí siembra maíz y papá; los que después los vende en el mercado central de su localidad. Pero no solo a la agricultura se dedica, ella también puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su localidad, donde abastece de productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores. En adelante quiere expandirse y abrir una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad y vender sus productos al por mayor. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que su fin es de progresar y triunfar. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará abono y fertilizantes para su cosecha de la misma manera invertirá una parte para contratar operarios que le ayuden en el cuidado de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Mardonia is 37 years old and is a young, single woman who is dedicated to her work. She lives in her own house located in the town of Chachunayo. Despite her age, Mardonia is not daunted by not having family by her side and, like a modern woman, thinks about progressing and getting ahead without the help of anyone because she knows well that hard work comes from much sacrifice. Since she was a little girl, she was taught to cultivate farm land. Now she has her own land and there she sows maize and potato which she later sells in the central market in her area. However, she is not only dedicated to agriculture. She also has a small grocery store where she supplies basic necessities to townspeople. In the future, she wishes to expand and open a grocery store in the city and sell her products at wholesale. This is the ninth loan with MFP and she is happy to belong to her community bank since her goal is to progress and triumph. With this loan, she will obtain fertilizer for her harvest and at the same time invest some of the money in hiring workers to help her take care of her crops.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and hire workers to help her with her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To refurbish the business space and install light fixtures

loans.name: Noelia

texts.en:
Noelia Gutierrez will use this loan to move her business, Electronic Tax Refund, from its current location in a cramped office to a larger, more inviting space across the street. The current location is so small that her customers have to wait outside to be helped.  The new office will allow her to help her customers more efficiently and comfortably. 

When she was 4 years old, Noelia and her family came to the United States from Mexico, working as migrant field workers. As a child, Noelia worked hard in school, and while not in school, she worked in vegetable and cotton fields with her family. When her father was diagnosed with cancer, her mother would pull Noelia out of school to sell tamales in order to pay the hospital fees. On the weekends, Noelia spent her time either selling tamales or working in the fields. Their neighbor worked as a notary public from home and started to teach Noelia how to complete income tax returns. The concept of working from home was incredibly appealing to Noelia. At the age of 14, she started doing the income tax returns of all the field workers for free so she could get experience. Noelia knew at a young age that she wanted a different life for herself and her family.

As a young adult, Noelia worked both in the fields and at an income tax firm as a clerk, and went to vocational night school. After graduating, she started helping people do their tax returns out of her house and it turned into a full-fledged business. 

This is not her first loan from ACCION Texas. Her first loan helped her pay for computers because previously everything was recorded by hand. This upgrade was instrumental to increasing the number of individuals she served from 150 to 3,000 clients.  

Noelia plans to eventually expand her business to more office locations in the Rio Grande Valley. She believes her business is so successful because she provides high quality work for an affordable price. She gives back by doing free tax returns for field workers who cannot afford her services. Currently, Noelia employs her husband and family at her office, and thus Noelia successfully reached her dream of creating a different life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To move into a new office space

loans.name: Diondra

texts.en:
After styling hair for six years, Diondra Y. decided to fulfill her dream of starting her own business: Pinkie’s Exotic Stylz, LLC. She plans to use her loan to equip her salon with everything a salon requires: chairs, products, massage table, waiting room furniture, etc. To prepare for this transition, Diondra took several business management classes and attended conferences on all the latest hair treatment methods. Her business offers infusions, relaxes, color treatments, hair replacements for cancer patients, weaving, microlinks and more. 

Diondra is a go-getter, to say the least. Not only is Diondra a single mother of two daughters, she is working closely with non-profit organizations on offering her services to homeless women to help them look presentable for job interviews.

loans.use: To buy salon furniture and products

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
After working at a canning company, Simon F. started Elsa Auto Body Shop in 1967 and has developed a loyal clientele. However, the summer months were slow, and he now needs a loan for working capital to help him get through this rough time. 

This is Simon’s second loan. In 2008, when Hurricane Dolly swept through Texas, the roof of his auto body shop went with it. Simon used his first loan to buy a new, solid roof that could endure the hurricane force winds and rain that annually threaten south Texas. The new roof allowed him to continue working and he successfully paid back the loan.

When business slows down, Simon does not stop working. He does other landscaping jobs in order to make the loan payments. 

As an avid rock collector, Simon hopes that one day he will be able to pursue his passion for rocks more actively.

loans.use: To keep inventory stocked during the low season

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old and he lives with his wife and two children in Virgen Purisima Concepcion in the district of Tucuma. This area exhibits a healthy mix of both rural agricultural activity and commercialization.

Juan raises animals for their subsequent sale at maturity or when they reach the appropriate size. He raises the animals at his home, providing them with balanced feed which he purchases. Juan has been raising animals for the past ten years and has significant experience with a variety of them. His animals are well regarded in the community due to his diligent care and breeding techniques.

This will be Juan’s first loan in the formal financial sector. He plans to use the loan proceeds to expand his herd, purchase additional feed in bulk and make repairs to his corrals. He hopes that these actions will assist him in increasing his family’s income. He dreams of putting his children through school so that they might become professionals. He would also like to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: expand his herd, purchase additional feed in bulk and make repairs to his corrals.

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, de 41 años, es una mujer trabajadora, esta casado con Eleazar, de 44 años, ambos tienen 7 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Unión Leticia. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se dedica a la venta de comida en un pequeño cuarto que acondicionó en su hogar, y por las noches vende hamburguesas; de esta manera este oficio le resulta muy rentable y puede apoyar en los gastos del hogar. Pero no solo a esa actividad se dedica Nery, desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra, ya cuando creció y consolidó su familia, pudo adquirir terrenos en donde cultiva habas, arveja y espinaca; con el tiempo y la experiencia que tiene, logro adecuarse bien al mercado y alquiló más terrenos de cultivo, con ello puede sembrar en grandes cantidades, por ende obtiene mejores ganancias. Ahora ella quiere comprar sus propios terrenos de cultivo; como también abrir su propio restaurante. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde reina la unión y solidaridad. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará fertilizantes para su cultivo de habas, ya que muy pronto cosechará.
texts.en: Nery, who is 41, is a hard-working woman. She is married to Eleazar who is 44 and they both have seven children. They live in a rented house located in Unión Leticia. Every morning, starting very early, she is dedicated to selling food in a small room in her house. And at night, she sells hamburgers. In this way, this job has become very profitable and she is able to pay the bills. But she is not only dedicated to this work. At a young age, Nery learned to farm and when she grew up and consolidated her family she was able to acquire land where she cultivates beans, peas and spinach. With time and the experience that she has, she was able to adapt to the market and rent more farmland. With this, she was able to plant in great quantities and obtain better earnings. Now, she wishes to buy her own farmland and open her own restaurant. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she is very happy to belong to her community bank where unity and solidarity reigns. With this loan, she will obtain fertilizers for her bean crops since she will harvest them very soon.

loans.use: Comprar fertilizantes para cuidar su cultivo de habas.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old and has no children. She lives in the Sialupe Baca neighborhood of Lambayeque, a zone that exhibits a high level of commercialization of agricultural products and animal raising.

Maria runs a small storefront out of her home where she sells goods to meet basic needs, such as soap, toilet paper, crackers, rice, beans, flour, and beverages. She has managed the store for over three years now and has a good presence in the community, given her high level of service and quality products.

This will be Maria’s first loan with our institution. She has good references and a good credit history. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices in order to realize greater profits and to expand her product offerings.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise at bulk prices

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.en:
Jose is 22 years old.  He lives in the center of Capilla Santa Rosa in Caserio Siaulupe Baca in Lambayeque, a rural region predominately populated by individuals who raise animals.

For the last two years, Jose has maintained a business raising and selling livestock. He provides them with feed and shelter within his home. Once they have grown to the appropriate size, he sells them to his neighbors or in local markets.

Jose is requesting this loan in order to expand his herd, purchase feed in bulk and make repairs to his corrals. He expects that these additions to his business will help him expand his business and gain additional independence.

Jose is a hardworking young man with a strong drive to get ahead in life. This will be his first loan with our institution and he exhibits a clean credit history.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals and feed and to repair the corrals

loans.name: Princesas X Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Princesas,les gustó el nombre porque se identifican con sus hijas y sus caricaturas favoritas,se sintieron contentas con la formación de su grupo el cual consta de 10 señoras.Todas y cada una de ellas tiene una historia diferente, el grupo es muy organizado y cumplido cuentan, son mujeres trabajadoras con negocios creados a base de sacrificios, todo con el afán de darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos, casi todas son casadas y también comparten sus ideales con sus esposos. La señora Guadalupe C. por ejemplo tiene un negocio de manualidades para todo tipo de eventos y quiere el préstamo para invertir en fieltro y artículos varios para la elaboración de sus manualidades, las que realiza con mucho esmero y así logra tener mucho trabajo. 
La presidenta se llama Blanca Martínez, ella vende calzado deportivo y escolar desde hace tiempo.En términos generales este grupo al día de hoy está sumamente motivado, sienten un verdadero aprecio por la gente que hace posible este préstamo y existe el compromiso de tener una relación comercial solida.
texts.en:
This group is called "Princesses."  They like this name because they identify it with their daughters and with their favorite cartoons.  They are happy to have formed the group consisting of ten women.  Each and every one of the women has a different story.  The group is very organized and all the members have all met.  They are hard-working women with businesses created through sacrifice, all in an effort to create a better future for their children.  Almost all are married and share their ideals with their husbands.

Member Guadalupe C. has a craft business for all types of events and wants a loan to invest in felt and sundry materials for the development of her craft items, which she makes with great care and thereby manages to work a lot.  Blanca Martínez is the president.  She has sold athletic and school shoes for some time.

In general, this group is highly motivated and feels a real appreciation for the people who make this loan possible.  They are committed to having a solid business relationship.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and invest in the businesses.

loans.name: Nohemy Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nohemy Yolanda; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y tiene 8 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte tiene un carro que hace servicio turístico llevando a turistas a diferentes lugares del Cusco, la socia quiere tener un negocio de venta de repuestos. La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la letra de su carro.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Nohemy Yolanda, 62, belongs to the SENOR DE MURUHUAY community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Nohemy, 62, is married and has 8 children.  She operates a taxi business.  She has a car in which she carries tourists to places of interest in and around Cusco.  She would like to set up a business selling spare parts.  She is applying for this loan to make a car payment.

Sra. Nohemy is grateful to everyone who has made her dream come true by this means and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para pagar la letra de su carro.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin P. C. is twenty-two years old, single and has no children. He lives with his parents in Caserio Solicape in the district of Mochumi in Lambayeque, an area that is predominately agricultural.

Benjamin raises animals and sells them to neighbors and in the local markets. He has been involved in this business for the last two years. He raises the animals in and around his home, providing his animals with both the plants that grow on his parent’s land and additional feed which he purchases.

Benjamin is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional animals and feed and for materials to make repairs to his corrals. Benjamin hopes to be able to expand his herd in order to better provide for himself and his family. It will be his first loan with our institution.

loans.use: To purchase animals and feed and for materials to make repairs to his corrals

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, D. 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora, convive con Eloy, D. 32 años; ambos tienen 2 hijos, Yocelin D. 10 y Tadeo D. 5 años, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en L. comunidad D. Chiras. Como toda mujer, se dedica a muchas labores durante el día; desD. las primeras horas del día cuida a los animales que cría (toro, cerdo, carnero, cuyes), a los que dedica L. mayor parte D. su tiempo, porqué sabe que cuando están bien alimentados, sus clientes comprarán carme a un mejor precio. Ya por L. tarD. se dedica al cuidado D. sus campos D. cultivo, donD. siembra arveja, papá, maíz y gladiolo, los que después los venD. en el mercado central D. su ciudad, a elL. le gusta mucho estar en el campo. Carmen quiere abrir un pequeño restaurante en su casa, ya comenzó preparando comida para los operarios D. otros terrenos D. cultivo, ahí venD. muchos platos gracias a su exquisito sabor. Es el quinto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho L. puntualidad y dedicación D. su banco comunal, con el que asegura podrá cumplir con su objetivo. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar 20 sacos D. abono con los cuales podrá cuidar su sembrío D. papa; asimismo desea comprar semillas D. habas para poder sembrar más adelante.
texts.en: Carmen, 32, is a hard-working woman.  She lives with Eloy, 32, and their 2 children: Yocelin, 10, and Tadeo, 5.  They live in a rented house in the community of Chiras.  Like women everywhere, Carmen spends her days hard at work.  She cares for the animals she raises (bulls, pigs, rams, guinea pigs) from early in the morning through much of the day because she knows that her customers will pay a better price for the animals when they are well cared for.  She works in her fields during the afternoon, growing peas, potatoes, maize and gladiolus which she then sells in the city's central market.  She is very happy on the farm.  Carmen wants to open a small restaurant in her house.  She recently started making meals for other farm workers and she sells what she makes because her meals are very tasty.  This is Carmen's fifth MFP loan.  She likes the commitment of her community bank because they have ensured that she is able to meet her goals.  She will use this loan to buy 20 sacks of manure to plant her potato crop.  She also wants to buy seeds for a bean crop.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Marina Sonia

texts.en:
Marina Sonia Q. V. is twenty-five years old. She lives with her partner and her son in Asientomiento Humano in the district of Lambayeque. Her home is located in an area that is characterized by its high level of commercialization.

For the last three years Marina has operated a small grocery store out of her home, selling products to meet basic needs including bread, cheese, butter, drinks, soap and other items. She is well known in the area for her high level of service and the good quality of her products.

Marina is requesting this loan, her first with our institution, in order to purchase additional merchandise and expand her offerings to the public. The demand for her goods has been high in recent months and she wants to take advantage of this opportunity to grow her business. She hopes that she will also be able to increase her profits by purchasing a few items in bulk.

Marina is a very hardworking young woman who is constantly focused on bettering the life of her family. She would like to continue to expand her business and provide for the education of her son.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise, some in bulk

loans.name: Danelia Justina

texts.es: Danelia Justina tiene 59 años, su actividad económica es una librería hace mas de 4 años que tiene este negocio por lo que es una mujer muy trabajadora y busca la forma de seguir adelante. Ella tiene 3 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente. Sus inicios se dan por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos del hogar a ella le gusta trabajar y mantener  a su familia. Ella necesita este crédito para la compra de materia prima como papel, tijeras entre otra cosas necesarias que le solicitan.
texts.en: Danelia Justina, 59, has operated a paper supply store for more than 4 years.  She is a hard-working woman and started the business as a way to get ahead in the world.  She has 3 children but all are independent.  At the beginning, Daniela needed the business to pay household expenses and support her family, but she came to find that she liked working.  She will use this loan to stock her business with products like paper, scissors and similar items that her customers want.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Diana Elizet

texts.en:
Diana Elizet F. S. is 20 years old, single and lives with her parents in Romero in the district of Morrope, Lambayeque, approximately forty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Diana creates traditional clothing and household goods. She began her business four years ago by helping her mother and has since gained her own clientele. Diana’s specialties include traditional back supports and shoulder bags. Her goods are used by local agricultural workers and other residents of the area to protect themselves in their work and carry their daily lunch into the fields. Diana also creates tablecloths of splendid colors that are popular with her customers and tourists. She sells her wares in the town of Romero and in the surrounding area during the week and in the artisian market of Morrope during the weekends.

Diana is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional fabric and thread in order to expand her product line and to make use of bulk purchase discounts. This will be Diana’s second loan from our institution and will replace a previous Kiva loan through Edpyme Alternativa of $250. She was responsible and punctual with her repayments in her prior loan. Her capacity to repay remains good, and we have therefore approved her for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and thread

loans.name: Kenia

texts.es:
Kenia es una de nuestras microempresarias se dedica a la venta de alimentos comestible, de consumo diario para la elaboracion de las comidas, es una pequeña tienda a la cual, en Republica Dominicana es llamada Colmado y vive en la ciudad de San Pedro de Macoris, una ciudad famosa por sus jugadores de pelota y por la industria azucarera, su economía actual depende de la Zona franca, la industria del cemento y otras actividades menores como el turismo. Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenía la necesidad de invertir en su negocio.

Kenia está muy emocionada de recibir su cinco préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 1 años, el cual inició con un pequeño capital que fue ahorrando mientras realizaba otros tipo de negocio. Kenia está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Sacos de Arroz, azucar, harina, habichuelas, entre otros alimentos. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, le gusta leer y su reto mas dificil ha sido estudiar. Su más grande sueño es poder convertirse en una profesional.
texts.en:
Kenia operates one of our small businesses.  She has a store--called a "colmado" in the Dominican Republic--where she sells the common food items that her customers need to make their daily meals.  It's a small store in the city of San Pedro de Macoris where she lives.  The city is famous for its sugar industry and the soccer balls that are made here.  The economy depends on a free trade zone, the cement industry and other activities such as tourism.  Kenia came to us because she needed to invest in her business.

Kenia is really excited to receive this, her fifth Esperanza Internacional loan, after having successfully repaid past loans and making great strides in growing her business.  She started the business a year ago with money that she managed to save while working at another business.  She plans to use this new loan to buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour and beans, among other things.  She will reinvest her earnings in the business.  Kenia likes to read and her most difficult challenge has been to go to school.  She would like to make herself over for a professional career.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.en:
Maria is a 31-year-old single woman with no children. She lives in Sialupe Baca near the city of Lambayeque, a region which is characterized by agriculture, specifically the raising of livestock.

For the past five years, Maria has made a living by producing and selling chicha out of her home.  Chicha is a traditional Peruvian beverage made of corn that is consumed during ancestral ceremonies. Many people who live in rural areas drink it during parties and before starting their chores since they believe it provides strength and energy. Maira prepares chicha in her home and offers it for sale to her neighbors. In addition to producing chicha, Maria also sells beer. She has a dedicated and loyal clientele as a result of her level of service and her good product. 

Maria wants to use this loan to purchase additional supplies for producing chicha and expanding her beer selection. In this manner, she hopes to increase her income and meet the demand of her clients. 

Maria doesn’t have any other active loans and has good references from her neighbors. She is a responsible and respected member of the community.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies for producing chicha

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA”; este banco está situado en el distrito D. Saylla en la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda; La socia tiene 64 años D. edad; ella es casada y tiene un restaurante chicharroneria, ella junto a su conyugue se dedican a la atención D. sus clientes en sus negocio. La socia está solicitando el crédito para implementar su negocio y mejorar el restaurante, ella comprara insumos y una mesa nueva para el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una meza y para los insumos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Yolanda, belongs to the LOS ROSALES D. SAYLLA community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Yolanda, 64, is married and operates a "chicharroneria" (a restaurant where she sells a traditional pork-based snack).  She, along with her husband, make their living from the business.  Sra. Yolanda is applying for a loan so that she can improve the restaurant.  She will use money from the loan to buy a new table and supplies for the business.

Sra. Yolanda is very grateful that this means of borrowing is availalbe to her and she is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Buy a table and supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Juana Elizabeth; ella tiene 51 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección y venta de chompas, ella confecciona y también compra algunas chompas para mujer, varón y niños y lo vende en forma independiente a las diferentes tiendas, la socia quiere tener una tienda para que pueda vender las chompas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar las chompas y también para comprar materiales para tejer las chompas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “SEÑOR DE MURUHUAY.” The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Juana Elizabeth. She is 51 years old and is a single mother of one son. The member alternates her daily activities between her tailoring business and selling sweaters. She tailors and also buys some women's sweaters and sells them independently in different stores. The member wants to have a store where she can sell the sweaters. The member is requesting this loan to buy sweaters and also to buy materials to weave sweaters. 

The member thanks the people who help her achieve this dream and she promises to fulfill the payments in the established period.

loans.use: The member requests this loan to buy sweaters and also to buy materials to weave sweaters.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 36 años, es una mujer hábil y trabajadora, convive con Crisanto, de 42 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Ella es una mujer con fuerza y mucho optimismo, hace ya 7 años que se dedica a la agricultura, ahí siembra maíz y papa, con la ayuda incondicional de su hija mayor Leonela; juntas viajan después de cada cosecha a diferentes lugares del país, Tarma, Oroya y Chanchamayo (selva central del país), donde comercializan su cosecha a buen precio. Pero no solo a esa actividad se dedica María, hace ya 2 años que deleita a propios y extraños con las ricos platos que prepara diariamente en su restaurante. Sin embargo lo que más desea es instalar una tienda de comestibles en su ciudad. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho reunirse y compartir momentos agradables con su banco comunal. Con el crédito que obtendrá comprará fertilizantes para el cultivo de papa que tiene.
texts.en: María, who is 36 years old, is a skilled and hard working woman. She lives with Crisanto, who is 42 years old, and together they have 3 children. They live in a rented house located in Chiras. She is a strong and optimistic woman and for the past 7 years has worked in agriculture, planting corn and potatoes with the faithful help of her oldest daughter, Leonela. Together they travel after every harvest to different places in the country, Tarma, Oroya and Chanchamayo (central forest of the country) where they market their harvest at a good price. But this isn't the only activity María dedicates herself to. For the past 2 years she has delighted her family and others with the delicious plates that she prepares daily in her restaurant. However, what she wants most is to install a grocery store in her city. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she likes to meet with and share pleasant times with her communal bank. With this loan that she will obtain she will buy fertilizers to cultivate the potatoes she has.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to cultivate potatoes.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is a 35-year-old single woman. She has no children and lives with her sisters in Morope, a commercial district within the region of Lambayeque.

Felicita has worked as a fish vendor in the Tucume market for the last 8 years. She purchases her fish daily from the bulk dealers who come to the city in the morning. This saves her the time and cost of travelling to the coast where the fishermen live. She hopes to be able to use this loan to purchase a greater quantity of fish in order to get a better discount and increase her profit margin.

Additionally, Felicita raises animals in the yard behind the home she shares with her sisters. The family raises these animals on rice chaff and local grasses until they are large enough to sell for their meat.

Felicita currently has no loans outstanding and has good references within the community. She is a very hardworking woman and has a very strong and supportive relationship with her sisters. She wants to continue to support her household and improve the famly's lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of fish

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela V. P. tiene 31 años de edad es soltera vive junto a su madre Rosalía P. Solís que ya es de edad (abuelita), en Colomi Comunidad Candelaria hacia el norte.         

La señora Gabriela se dedica a la venta de abarrotes todos los días aparte de lo que se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, papaliza así se mantienen las dos madre e hija, razón que ella se apersono  a nuestra oficina a solicitar un crédito porque necesitan construir una vivienda donde se compraron un lote terreno sobre el camino, así como también trasladar su venta de abarrotes y tener mejores ingresos, finalmente la señora Gabriela nos dice que ampliara mas su venta de abarrotes para darse mejores condiciones de vida y vivir más cómodos junto a su madre querida.
texts.en:
Gabriela V. P. is 31 years old and single. She lives together with her mother, Rosalía P. Solís, who is already an elderly grandmother, in  Colomi, in Candelaria community toward the north.          

Gabriela works selling groceries every day. She also works in agriculture, producing potatoes, beans and papa lisa (ulluco). In this way, she supports both of them, mother and daughter. For this reason, she appeared in the office to request a loan, because they need to build a house on a lot they purchased along the road. She will also move her grocery business there and have a better income. Finally, Gabriela reports that she will expand her grocery sales to provide better living conditions and live more comfortably together with her beloved mother.

loans.use: Investing in improving her housing

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.en:
Juan is a 25-year-old single man with no children. He lives with his mother in the commercial zone of Lambayeque.

Juan has been selling vegetables near the central market of Lambayeque for two years.  In the market, he sells corn, beans, potatoes, yucca and other locally grown vegetables. He also owns a moto-taxi. He uses the moto-taxi to transport his goods and as an additional income-generating activity when he is not at the market.

He plans to use the credit to expand his merchandise and maintain his moto-taxi.

Juan’s dream is to open up his own stall within the market, an action that will stabilize his business and customer base, reduce his waste and increase his profits.

loans.use: Purchase additional vegetables and maintain his moto-taxi

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Since April, Maricela has been busy setting up La Quinta Drive-Thru, a drive-in convenience store complete with anything you would expect to find at a corner shop, except customers never have to exit their cars. Originally from Mexico, Maricela and her husband came to the U.S. to work as migrant field workers. After constantly relocating throughout the United States due to the seasonal changes, Maricela, her husband, and her three children settled down in McAllen. The couple began working as custodians for their current employer, the McAllen Independent School District. Maricela is excited to retire and work full-time at the store. Until then, she works nights and weekends, and her daughter will work during the weekdays.

Maricela spent her savings to set up the business and needed this loan for the final touches. This loan will pay for the roof that will cover the cars and will help Maricela to buy goods to sell. Maricela says, “All my life I have worked. When I retire, I want to have something that’s mine and that can secure a better future for my family.”

loans.use: To construct a roof to cover cars and buy inventory to stock up the store

loans.name: Maria Alejandria

texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old, married and has four children. She lives with her husband and children in their own home in Tucume. 

Maria makes a living raising livestock, specifically guinea pigs, goats, ducks, and chickens. She feeds her animals local plants and the chaff from the rice harvests in the region. Once her animals have reached the appropriate age and size, Maria sells them for their meat in the Moshoqueque market in Chiclayo. Maria’s husband works as a farmhand, a job that takes him out of the home most days and requires his constant attention in order to maintain work. 

Maria is requesting this loan in order to purchase additional food for her animals. It will be her first loan. She hopes to be able to expand her herd and increase the income of her household. Maria is very dedicated to the well being of her family and dreams of expanding their home and providing an education to all her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her animals

loans.name: Nasario

texts.es: El señor  Nasario Díaz C. tiene 28 años de edad es soltero vive solo en Colomi Comunidad Mosoj Rancho hacia el norte.                                                                                                                                    Del señor Nasario Díaz su actividad principal es la producción agrícola, aparte tiene 6 cabezas de ganado vacuno que los utiliza en las faenas agrícolas, pero el necesita un préstamo para comprar más ganado vacuno lechero y terneros  razón se apersono a nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito, finalmente el señor Nasario Díaz C. nos cuenta que su sueño es mejorar su actividad pecuaria y tener mejores condiciones de vida a futuro.
texts.en:
Nasario Díaz C. is 28 years old and single. He lives along in Colomi, in the Mosoj Rancho community toward the north. 

Nasario Díaz' main work is agricultural production. He also has 6 head of cattle, which he uses in his agricultural work. However, he needs a loan to buy more milk cows and calves. For this reason, he appeared at the office to request a loan. Finally, Nasario Díaz C. reports that his dream is to improve his ranching business and have better living conditions in the future.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Emprendedoras 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Ana es una D. L. miembros del Grupo Emprendedoras 2 y 3, ellas son microempresarias dedicadas a las ventas D. ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, educacion, etc; en la ciudad D. L. Alcarrizos, una ciudad industrial al norte D. S. Domingo, con una gran poblacion y un buen crecimientofa. Está asociada D. Esperanza se dedica a la venta D. Leche y otros productos derivados D. la misma como Yogur y queso.

Ana esta recibiendo su segundo prestamo en Esperanza, despues D. haber terminado y haber invertido su primer prestamo para la formacion D. su negocio, poco a poco a podimos invertir en otros productos para inicial un Colmado ( una pequeña tienda para ventas D. alimentos ),  va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invertiendo en su negocio. Su reto mas dificil criar a sus  a sus 3 hijos, junto a su esposo para que sean personas D. bien, educados y profesionales. a la ves que estudiaba y trabajaba. Su sueño es seguir avanzando en su negocio, con el fin D. poder tener un mejor futuro
texts.en:
Ana is one of the members of the "Grupo Emprendedoras 2 y 3" [Group of Entrepreneurial Women 2 and 3]. They are microentrepreneurs dedicated to selling clothing, natural products and shoes, providing education, etc., in the city of L. Alcarrizos, an industrial city north of S. Domingo with a large population and strong growth. This associate of Esperanza works selling milk and other products derived from the same, such as yogurt and cheese. 

Ana is receiving her second loan with Esperanza, after having paid off her first loan, which she invested in starting her business. Little by little she was able to invest in other products in order to open a "Colmado" (a small food store). She will use her earnings to continue investing in her business. Her most difficult challenge has been raising her 3 children, together with her husband, so that they will be successful, educated and professional people, at the same time that she has been studying and working. Her dream is to continue making progress with her business, with the aim of having a better future.

loans.use: Buying milk and other dairy products (yogurt, cheese)

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es: Leyla, de 52 años,  es una mujer madura y seria, es madre soltera, tiene una hija que se llama Fiorella, de 23 años, con la que vive en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia. A pesar de las constantes dificultades que logró pasar para educar a su hija, ella siente que su vitalidad sigue intacta. Hace ya 20 años que viene dedicándose a la agricultura, oficio que le ayudó a pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija, ahora según sus propias palabras, “siembra por que lo toma como un pasatiempo”. Todos los fines de semana se dirige a su terreno de cultivo, donde cuida sus plantaciones de maíz, papa y habas, que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad; con el tiempo ella logró abrir una pequeña tienda de comestibles, donde diariamente vende productos de primera necesidad, por lo que espera surtir más su tienda de abarrotes. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y le agrada las reuniones de su banco comunal, ahí comparte experiencias de éxito. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja y zanahoria, que en estos meses está pensando cultivar.
texts.en: Leyla, age 52, is a mature and serious woman. She is the single mother of Fiorella, age 23, with whom she lives in her own house, located in the town of La Unión Leticia. In spite of ongoing difficulties, she was able to educate her daughter and help her get ahead. She feels that her vitality is still intact. For the past 20 years, she has been working in agriculture, a profession that has helped her pay for her daughter's university studies. Now, in her own words, "I plant because I treat it as a hobby." Every weekend, she goes out to her fields where she takes care of her crops of corn, potatoes and beans, which after every harvest she sells in the central market of her city. Over time, she was able to open a small food store, where she sells basic products each day. In the future, she is planning to stock her store with a broader range of groceries. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she enjoys the meetings of her communal bank, where she shares experiences of success. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy carrot and pea seeds, which she is thinking of cultivating in these months.

loans.use: Buying pea and carrot seeds

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor  Daniel P. Q. tiene 19 años de edad es conviviente con la señora Clementina Zambrana, Montaño tienen un hijito de 9 meses, viven en Colomi Comunidad Palta Loma hacia el norte.      
                                                                                                      El señor Daniel P. se dedica a la actividad agrícola produce papa, oca, papaliza anualmente y lleva a comercializar en los días de feria semanal de Colomi, aparte tiene 2 cabezas de ganado vacuno (yunta) que los utiliza en las faenas agrícolas y una lechera, el necesita un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) mas una cabeza de ganado vacuno, por lo que se apersono a solicitar un crédito, por último el señor Daniel  nos dice que su sueño es mejorar la calidad de vida y tener ingresos mejores a futuro. y así poder mantener de lo mejor a su familia que tiene por delante.
texts.en:
Daniel P. Q. is 19 years old. He lives together with Clementina Zambrana Montaño, and they have a little 9-month-old child. They live in Colomi, in the Palta Loma community toward the north. 

Daniel P. works in agriculture, growing potatoes, oca (yams) and papa lisa (ulluco) each year. He takes them to sell during the weekly market days in Colomi. In addition, he has 2 heads of working cattle which he uses for agricultural tasks, as well as a milk cow. He needs the loan to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure), as well as another cow. For this reason, he came in to request a loan. Finally, Daniel reports that his dream is to improve his quality of life and have a better income for the future, so that he can provide as well as possible for his growing family.

loans.use: Buying organic fertilizer for his farm and another cow

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora; ella convive con Wilfred, de 46 años, ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 3 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia. Con la ayuda, empeño y dedicación de su esposo pudo progresar y lograr sus objetivos, ya tiene 2 casas y ahora quiere comprarse un camión, con ello podrá trasladar los productos que hace 20 años viene sembrando con esmero y ahínco. En su terreno de cultivo siembra, arveja, papa y maíz, los que después de cada cosecha, lleva a la capital para comercializar a los compradores del mercado central. Edith viaja por lo menos 3 veces por semana, la adquisición de un camión reducirían los gastos de envío. Le gusta mucho la agricultura y sobre todo sembrar arveja, porqué invierte poco y obtiene mayores utilidades en corto tiempo. Es el segundo crédito con MFP y le agrada pertenecer a un banco comunal, donde prima la unión y solidaridad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará fertilizantes para su cultivo de habas.
texts.en: Edith is 42 years old. She is a happy and hard-working woman. She lives with Wilfred who is 46 years old. Together they have five children but only three of them live in their home. Their home is located in La Union Leticia. With the help, determination and dedication of her husband, she has been able to progress and reach her objectives. Now they own two houses and they want to buy a truck. With the truck they will move the products that they have grown with great care and ardor for the past twenty years. On their farmland they grow peas, potatoes and corn. After every harvest they bring these items to the capitol to sell to buyers in the central market. Edith travels at least three times a week. Owning a truck would reduce her transportation costs. She likes agriculture a lot and beyond this she likes to grow peas, because they require a small investment and she gets a larger profit in a shorter time. This is her second loan with MFP and she is thankful to belong to a community bank where they value unity and solidarity. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy fertilizer so that she can grow beans

loans.use: She will buy fertilizer to grow beans.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Guillermo, de 59 años, es un hombre líder y responsable, casado y producto de su amor tuvo 3 hijos; los que son su dicha y alegría; ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Huaracayo. Hace 40 años que se dedica a la siembra de maíz del cuzco (una variedad híbrida del maíz, cuyos granos son más grandes y ricos), lechuga, espinaca y col. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura es poder sembrar y cuidar los productos que la naturaleza le brinda; con ello asegura la calidad de sus cultivos; de la misma manera tiene una pequeña huerta en su casa donde siembra limones, que son los más grandes y jugosos de su localidad.  Guillermo también se dedica a la compra y venta de carros; compra a un precio determinado y lo vende a un precio mayor, ese transacción le genera muchas utilidades. Gracias a su buen juicio en los negocios, Guillermo puede ahorrar para comprar más terrenos de cultivo, en los cuales está pensando sembrar mayor cantidad de hortalizas. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y como autoridad de su banco comunal se siente muy orgulloso de poder ayudar a las personas, que como él quieren salir adelante. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono, fertilizantes, medicinas para cuidar su cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 59, is responsible and a leader, married, and as a product of this love, he has 3 children.  They are his joy and happiness.  They live in his  house located in the town of Huaracayo.  For 40 years, he has worked by planting cuzco corn (a hybrid variety of corn whose kernels are bigger and tastier), lettuce, spinach, and cabbage. What he most likes about farming is to be able to plant and care for the goods nature gives him. Through his care, he assures the quality of his crops.  In the same way, he has a small garden near his house where he plants lemons which are the biggest and juiciest in town. Guillermo also works by  buying and selling from a cart.  He buys at a certain price and then sells at a higher price. This transaction creates a lot of money. Thanks to his good business judgement, Guillermo saved money to buy more land to cultivate in which he is thinking about planting a greater quantity of vegetables. 

This is his tenth credit with MFP and as an authority of his community bank, we feel prideful to be able to help people that, like him, want to prosper.  With the asked for loan, he will buy fertilizer and medicine to care for his crop of corn.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and medicine for his crop of corn.

loans.name: Mike

texts.en:
A true animal lover, Mike began working with animals at a young age. After earning a degree in Animal Care in England, he joined the Ringling Brothers Barnum and Bailey Circus as head elephant trainer. Many cities and towns later, Mike moved to California and switched to horses. 

Today Mike drives from farm to farm as a farrier, a blacksmith who specializes in horse care. His business is about three years old and very busy. Horses need new shoes every 5-8 weeks, and with a limited number of farriers in the area, Mike is constantly responding to calls. 

After his bank told him that his loan request was too small, Mike was referred to Opportunity Fund. "The loan process at Opportunity Fund was way easier than I thought it would be."  Mike will use a $10,000 loan to purchase a customized farrier trailer to transport his equipment from farm to farm. "This way, if my truck breaks down, I won't miss a day of work."

loans.use: To purchase a customized farrier trailer to transport horseshoeing equipment from farm to farm

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, D. 63 años, divorciada y abuela; ahora ella vive con su nieta Lesli D. 15 años, a quien cuida y educa en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad D. Huaracayo. A pesar D. su edad, su fuerza y vitalidad siguen siendo su mayor virtud; ella tiene 49 años dedicándose a la agricultura; D. la que según sus propias palabras, es su mayor satisfacción. Sembrar maíz, papa, col, arveja y habas; le han generado grandes utilidades y en todo el tiempo que trabajó con su banco comunal, le permitió adquirir un pequeño local en el mercado central D. su ciudad, ahí venD. los días miércoles, viernes y domingo, los productos que cosecha en sus terrenos D. cultivo.  Catalina, sabe muy bien que su fuerza y vitalidad disminuirán y pensando en el futuro D. su nieta; está planeando darle un mejor acabado a las 3 casas, que logró adquirir con tanto esfuerzo; sus planes son arrendarlas y obtener un dinero extra. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le brindó los integrantes D. su banco comunal; “con su apoyo puD. vencer muchas dificultades”, menciona. Con el crédito que obtendrá; comprará semillas D. papa, que dentro D. unos meses sembrará en su terreno D. cultivo.
texts.en:
Catalina is a 63 year old, divorced grandmother.  She lives with who 15 year old granddaughter.  She cares for her and educates her in her own house, which is located in Huaracayo.  In spite of her age, her strength and vitality continue to be her greatest virtues.  

She has been farming for 49 years.  She says that it is her greatest pleasure.  She grows corn, potatoes, cabbage, peas, and beans.  These crops have been very profitable.  All of the time that she worked with her communal bank allowed her to get a small place in her city’s central market.  This is where sells the crops that she harvests.  She sells there on Wednesdays, Fridays, and Sundays.  

Catalina well knows that her strength and vitality will diminish.  Thinking about her granddaughter’s future, Catalina is planning on improving the three houses that she managed to get with so much effort.  Her plan is to rent them in order to get extra money.

This is her tenth loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support of the members of her communal bank.  “With their help I was able to overcome many difficulties,” she says.  She will use the loan to buy seeds for potatoes, which she will plant on her fields within a few months.

loans.use: Buy seeds for potatoes

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa H. started her business, Las Misiones Arts and Crafts, after she met a representative of ACCION Texas-Louisiana at a flea market a year ago. Elsa would sell crafts at several different venues, including the flea market, festivals, fairs and celebratory events. However, she only sold crafts on the weekends and could not secure a steady income. Therefore, when she was approached by an ACCION representative a year ago, she jumped on the opportunity to start her own business, something that she had always dreamed of!

Elsa will use this loan to buy inventory like pottery, paintings, statues, fountains, and Aztec and Mayan art to sell at her store. All of her inventory is bought throughout Mexico, with an emphasis on items from Guadalajara. Elsa hopes to eventually start more businesses in the El Paso area and to continue to improve her English. Her advice to people unemployed and looking for a job is, “Keep trying. There is help. You just have to keep looking.”

loans.use: To purchase inventory: pottery, paintings, statues, fountains, and Aztec and Mayan art

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es: Cynthia, de 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y de sus 4 hermanos; juntos trabajan cada día para salir adelante. A pesar de su edad trabaja a diario con la única consigna de buscar el progreso. Es por esta razón que hace 1 año se asoció en un grupo de damas tejedoras de la zona donde vive; juntas realizan todo tipo de trabajos que comercializan en el interior y exterior del país. Teje diversidad de carteras y bolsos; además de pulseras y collares, y le gusta mucho su labor ya que la desarrolla desde la comodidad de su casa y obtiene regulares ganancias. A la semana produce una cantidad de artículos tejidos y los vende a los mayoristas de la ciudad;  los precios varían de acuerdo al destino de la mercadería. Lo que no le gusta a Cynthia es trabajar para otros, cuando sabe que si vendiera ella misma obtendría mejores ganancias. Como es una joven emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una librería bazar en algún mercado de su zona, pues anhela ser dueña de un negocio propio.  Es el primer crédito con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Cynthia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de material en hilos de diversos colores, entre otros que necesita para producir sus tejidos en mayor cantidad, de esta manera espera seguir adelante.
texts.en: Cynthia is 20 and lives with her paretns and her 4 siblings; together they work every day to get ahead.  In spite of her young age she works daily with the only goal to find progress.  That's why a year ago she joined a group knitting ladies of the area where she lives, together they make all kinds of products that they sell in and outside the country.  She knits different types of purses and handbags, also bracelets and necklaces and likes her work because she can do it from the comfort of her home and obtain income.  Every week she makes a number of knitted products and sells them to the wholesalers of the city.  Prices vary according to the destination of the merchandise.  What Cynthia doesn't like is having to work for other people knowing that if she made the final sale herself she would obtain higher income.   She is a young entrepreneur and has planned for the future to open a bookstore and bazaar in a marketplace of the zone because she wishes to have her own business.  This is the first loan with MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually because she doesn't want to let down the people that made possible the money that will allow her to continue working in the search for progress.  Cynthia plans to invest the loan in buying yarn of different colors to knit more products and continue to get ahead.

loans.use: Buy various colors of yarn to continue making handbags.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro, de 60 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Lina de 35 años y sus 3 pequeños hijos, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Desde muy joven aprendió las técnicas para la construcción de viviendas; y en la actualidad se desempeña como obrero en diferentes trabajos, y lo contratan por temporadas. Le gusta mucho su labor pues obtiene ganancias que le permiten ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Él esta muy orgulloso pues su pareja lo ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ya que  trabaja como tejedora de bolsos y accesorios en una asociación de damas de su zona. Juntos buscan que trabajar a diario sin descuidar la educación de sus pequeños hijos. Como Pedro es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado terminar de construir su vivienda, e instalar un negocio en ese lugar, pues quiere dejar bien asegurado el futuro de sus hijos. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Pedro tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de algunas herramientas que necesita para su labor como obrero; además quiere ayudar a su pareja en la compra de materiales que necesita para seguir tejiendo, de esta manera espera continuar trabajando.
texts.en: Pedro is 60 years old and lives in his own house with his spouse, 35, and their 3 children. Together they work every day to get ahead. When he was very young, he learned the techniques to build houses. At present, he works as a laborer at different jobs. He is hired seasonally. What he likes the most about his job is getting income which allows him to offer a good quality of life to his family. He is very proud and his spouse helps him with the household expenses. She works weaving bags and accessories in a women's association in the area. Together they look for work every day while still raising their small children. Since Pedro is an enterprising man he has planned for the future finishing his house and setting up a business there. He wants to insure the future of his children. This is the first loan that he has had with MFP and he promises to make his payments on time since he doesn't want to look bad to the people who made this money possible, which will allow him to continue working and seeking progress. Pedro plans on investing the loan he has applied for in purchasing some tools that he needs for his work as a laborer. In addition, he wants to help his spouse purchase materials she needs to keep weaving, and in this way she hopes to keep working.

loans.use: To purchase tools to continue his work as a laborer.

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: L. señora Amelia tiene 43 años, vive en L. zona D, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos que cuida, además es L. presidenta del grupo: “Las Esmeraldas” el cual se conforma por 8 vecinas que vienen trabajando 7 años con Edaprospo.
