Amelia vende productos de belleza de Avon y ESICA, ah hecho esto por 20 años, también vende cebiche, gaseosas y cerveza los domingos para ayudar a su pareja, que es albañil, a mantener su hogar y los estudios de Diseño Grafico de su hija FioreL., gracias a su esfuerzo y L. ayuda de Edaprospo ah lograd implementar un cuarto más en su casa, espera pronto poner su propia Boutique, pero para esto desea que Edaprospo haga más habilitaciones para su grupo.L. señora Ana, socia pasiva esta aun con sus amigas y les apoya ensus reuniones, aunque esta vez no este participando.
texts.en: Amelia is 43 years old. She lives in Zona D. She is in a common law marriage and has 3 children she is raising. She is also the president of the “Las Esmeraldas” group, which is made up of 8 neighbors who have been working with Edaprospo for 7 years. Amelia sells Avon and ESICA beauty products. She has done this for 20 years. She also sells ceviche and soft drinks on Sundays to help her spouse, who is a bricklayer, support the home and pay for the graphic design classes for their daughter FioreL.. Thanks to her hard work and help from Edaprospo, she has been able to add another room on to her house. She hopes to be able to open her own boutique soon, but for this she hopes that Edaprospo will make more authorizations for her group. Ana is a passive member who still is with her friend supporting them in meetings, although she is not participating at this time.

loans.use: To buy products and materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn in a variety of colors so that she can continue to knit

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel Cristina Sábalos R., tiene la edad de 29 años, es  madre soltera de 3 hijos menores de edad, todos están dedicados a los estudios, ella es agricultora de piña con una experiencia de más de 15 años, y fue su mama quien le enseño los trabajos del campo, a lo largo de estos años ha batallado contra, enfermedades de las tierras, plagas y sequias, es para su negocio que solicita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas e insumos vegetativos para un mantenimiento fitosanitario optimo para una mayor producción de las cosechas, y permita el aumento en los volúmenes de venta que apoyen a la economía de su familia, puesto que ella no cuenta con el apoyo de ningún familiar o su ex pareja.
texts.en: Isabel Cristina Sábalos R. is 29 years old. She is the single mother of 3 dependent children, all of them dedicated to studying. She is a farmer who grows pineapple, with more than 15 years of experience. It was her mother who taught her how to work in the fields, and through the years she has battled against soil diseases, pests and plagues. It is for her business that she is requesting a loan, to buy fertilizers, fungicides and plant materials. This will provide optimal phytosanitary maintenance for better production at harvest time, permitting her to increase her sales and thus support the economy of her family, since she does not receive help from any family members or her ex-partner.

loans.use: Supplies to provide phytosanitary maintenance for her crops

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores se dedica a la venta de nacatamales, hace más de 12 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora.  Por lo que se levanta muy temprano para realizar este tipo de platillos tan deliciosos que sus  clientes le solicitan. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como hojas, masa, entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Dolores has been selling nacatamales (pork, vegetables and corn masa wrapped in a banana leaf) for the past twelve years.  She is very committed to improving her food stall and her business. She is a hardworking woman. She gets up very early in the morning in order to make this delicious food that her customers always request. She is asking for this loan in order to buy materials such as leaves, corn masa, and other things.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar C. V., tiene la edad de 39 años es casado y su esposa se dedica a realizar las tareas del hogar ellos habitan en el barrio Las Perlas, tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que se dedican a los estudios, pero el mayor de ellos apoya a su padre en las actividades del campo, puesto que ellos son agricultores de piña, desde hace mas de 18 años. Tiempo en el que las plagas han disminuido la producción y por ende las ventas  que no permiten una mejor condición económica de la familia. Es por esta razón que solita un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, insumos vegetativos, que puedan emplear un mantenimiento fitosanitario adecuado para sus siembras, ellos son personas responsables, una familia muy unida y organizada, que tras otros prestamos han sabido utilizarlos de forma tal manera que han logrado mejorar continuamente su situación económico-social.
texts.en: Julio Cesar C. V., 39, is married and his wife devotes herself to the household tasks.  They live in the Las Perlas neighborhood, and they have 3 minor children who are in school. The oldest child helps his father with the farming activities; their family has been farming pineapples for more than 18 years.  At times diseases have reduced their production and sales, which has not allowed them to have good economic conditions for the family.  For this reason Julio requests a loan to buy fertilizers and farming supplies that will help them keep their crops healthy.  They are responsible people, a family that is very united and organized.  They have been able to use previous loans to continuously improve their socio-economic situation.

loans.use: to buy supplies to keep their crops healthy

loans.name: Jose Hector

texts.es:
José Héctor es un padre de familia de 70 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Santa Clara del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a labores asociadas a la agricultura. Por un lado posee vacas de las cuales comercializa a diario la leche que producen a un acopiador de la zona. Adicionalmente posee un pequeño terreno de cultivo en el que suele sembrar maíz y pasto, los cuales utiliza para agenciarse de ingresos adicionales y alimentar con sus derivados a sus vacas.

José desea adquirir material de construcción para implementar el corral que posee con nuevos comederos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El es una persona con bastante conocimiento y experiencia sobre el manejo de ganado y cultivos. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Jose is a family man who is seventy years old and lives with his family in the Santa Clara sector of the Pitipo District. This is an agricultural zone that is located in the Ferreñafe Province, a little more than an hour from Chiclayo.
Since he was young, Jose has worked in agriculture. On the one hand he has cows that produce milk that he sells each day to a collector in his zone. Also he has a small piece of land where he grows grain and hay, which he uses to eek out some additional income and also to feed his cows.
Jose would like to buy construction material in order to build a corral, as he owns some new animals. It is because of this need that he finds it convenient to ask for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. He is asking for a loan of 1000 new soles, money that will help him achieve his objectives. He is a very knowledgeable and experienced person in the fields of ranching and farming. Everyone that knows him looks upon him with much esteem and respect.

loans.use: To buy material to build a corral.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José Raúl es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el sector Puerto Arturo del distrito de Reque, una zona situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la fabricación y reparación de estructuras metálicas (carpintería metálica). Para lo cual cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado en su domicilio. El trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes principales son los mototaxistas del lugar que siempre acuden a el para reparar algunas fallas en sus vehículos. Este negocio le permite agenciarse de algunos ingresos, los cuales utiliza en el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

José Raúl desea implementar su negocio con la compra de más materiales y herramientas que le ayuden a llevar su negocio de la mejor manera posible. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

José Raúl siempre se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su negocio. El es responsable y bastante empeñoso. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y de confianza.
texts.en:
Jose Raúl is a 34-year-old family man who lives with his wife and three children in the Puerto Arturo sector in the Reque District. This zone is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
He works fabricating and repairing metals structures (metal carpentry). He works in a small shop at his home. His work is based on customer requests. His primary customers are motor taxis drivers from his area. They always come to him when they have problems with their vehicles. This business permits him to eek out an income that he uses to support his family. Jose Raúl would like to expand his business by purchasing materials and tools. This is the best way to grow his business. For this reason he has found it convenient to ask for a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1500 new soles. 
Jose Raúl is always looking for ways to improve his business. He is responsible and persevering. People that know him consider him a calm and confidant person.

loans.use: To buy more materials and tools

loans.name: Fredesvinda

texts.es:
Fredesvinda es una madre D. familia D. 48 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, una zona comercial que es a su vez la capital D. la provincia del mismo nombre situada en la región La Libertad, a dos horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desD. hace quince años a la venta D. abarrotes en un puesto D. venta ubicado en el mercadillo D. su distrito. Ella depenD. D. esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Por ello se esfuerza diariamente para conseguir más clientes y aumentar su nivel D. ventas.

Fredesvinda desea adquirir más productos para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas. Por ello ha creido conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante trabajadora y honrada. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is a 48 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Pacasmayo district, a commercial zone that is also the capital of the province by the same name, located in the La Libertad region, two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque.

For the past 15 years she’s been selling groceries from a stall in the marketplace in her district.  She depends on this business to help her husband move the family ahead.  She works hard every day to attract new customers and increase her sales.

Fredesvinda wants to acquire more products to be able to expand her business and increase her sales, so she has seen fit to request a loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa, to help her reach her goal.

She is a very hard working and honest woman.  She has had previous loans through our institution and has proven herself to be punctual and responsible with her payments.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Wilson Javier

texts.es:
Wilson es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Puerto Arturo del distrito de Reque,una zona ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de alquiler de equipos de sonido para amenizar fiestas y actividades sociales. Los dias en los que tiene mas demanda son los fines de semana. Y debido a la experiencia que posee en el rubro su negocio es conocido y cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles. Adicionalmente posee una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar servicios de transporte) con la cual brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros por la zona.

Wilson desea brindar mantenimiento a sus equipos y adquirir algunos nuevos implementos que le permitan ofrecer un mejor servicio, por ello ha considerado pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar su objetivo.

Wilson es una persona bastante emprendedora y trabajadora. En la zona sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien tranquilo y de confianza
texts.en:
Wilson is a 27 year old father who lives with his wife and children in the Puerto Arturo sector of the Reque district, a zone located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  He rents out sound systems for parties and social activities and has the greatest demand on the weekends.  Because of his experience in the trade, his business is well known and he has loyal customers.

He also has a moto-taxi (a modified motorcycle with a passenger compartment fitted to it) which he uses to provide transportation services for passengers and cargo.

Wilson wants to perform maintenance on his equipment and acquire some additional items that will allow him to provide better service, so he has seen fit to request a 1,000 PEN ($375) loan through Edpyme Alternativa, that will allow him to meet his objective.  Wilson is a very hard working and enterprising person.  His neighbors and acquaintance in the zone consider him to be an easygoing and trustworthy person.

loans.use: Equipment maintenance

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos menores de edad, vive en el sector Micarcape que pertenece al distrito de Monsefú, una zona conocida por sus ferias y festividades religiosas y también por la calidad de sus trabajos artesanales, se encuentra situada a más de veinticinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se gana la vida trabajando como maestro albañil desde hace más de seis años de experiencia, el realiza su oficio en lugares aledaños a su comunidad y trabaja en base a contratos. Esta actividad le permite sacar adelante a su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de sí para salir adelante.
 
El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda. Para ello necesita adquirir el material que le permita realizar esta acción. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Esta acción le permitirá otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para hacerles progresar y salir adelante. En la zona donde vive las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Maximo is 30-years-old, married and has three minor children. He lives in the Micarcape section that belongs to the Monsefu district, a zone that is known for its fairs and religious festivities and also for the quality of its handicrafts. It is located more than twenty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
He earns a living working as a master bricklayer. He has more than six years of experience. He works in the surrounding areas of his community. He works by contract. This works allows his family to progress. He wants the best for his family.
He would like to make some improvements to his home. In order to do this he needs to buy materials. For this reason he has found it convenient to ask for a loan of 1000 new soles.
Improving his home will provide a better quality of life for his family. His primary goal is to keep working in order to help his family progress and move forward. In the zone where he lives, the people that know him consider him a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: He would like to improve his home.

loans.name: Justo Santos

texts.es:
Justo tiene 52 años, es casado, y tiene un hijo menor de edad, vive en el Pueblo Joven Garces, una zona urbano marginal que pertenece al distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, el distrito más grande de la región, es también el distrito con mayores índices de probreza. Actualmente es una comunidad  grande ya que con el paso de los años su poblacion ha ido incrementándose y de igual manera su movimiento comercial.

Justo trabaja como chofer en una empresa de transportes de la zona, encargada de transporte de pasajeros y también de transporte de encomiendas. El ya tiene más de dos años de antigüedad en este trabajo y gracias a el ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Actualmente Justo necesita realizar algunas mejoras en la vivienda donde reside ya que esta esta sufriendo algunos daños y las personas que residen en ella no pueden vivir cómodamente. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Justo es una persona bastante trabajadora y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y los ha cancelado de un modo puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Justo is 52 years old.  He is married, has one young son, and lives in Pueblo Joven Garces, a marginal urban zone, belonging to the José Leonardo Ortiz district, the largest in the region.  It’s also the district with the highest incidents of poverty.  It is currently a large community, and its population and commercial state have been growing over the years.

Justo works as a driver for a transportation company in the zone.  He transports passengers and runs errands.  He’s been doing this work for two years and thanks to it, he’s been able to get ahead with his family.

Now Justo needs to make some improvements to his home.  Because it’s in need of repair, they cannot live comfortably in it, so he has seen fit to request a loan of 2,000 PEN ($725) through Edpyme Alternativa (E.A.).  Justo is very hard working and always gives his best to get his family ahead.  He’s had previous loans through E.A. and has repaid them responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Benita Del Pilar

texts.es:
Benita es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de uso diario. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida ya que se encarga de brindar un buen trato a su cliente. Ella utiliza los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Benita desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más artículos de modo que pueda ampliar su nivel de ventas y por consiguiente, sus ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Benita es una mujer bastante trabajadora y luchadora. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para otorgarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Benita is a 38 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the agricultural district of Olmos, a zone in the Lambayeque province, located more than one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past three years, Benita has sold groceries from a store located within her home.  There she offers all sorts of daily use products, and her business does well because she treats her customers well.  She uses her income to help her husband maintain the financial health of the family.

Benita wants to expand her business by buying more items so that she can expand her sales and earnings.  For this she has seen fit to request her first loan of 1,000 PEN ($375) through Edpyme Alternativa to help accomplish her objective.

Benita is a struggling hard working woman.  Those who know her pay her much admiration and respect.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Asterio

texts.es:
Asterio es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Filoque, una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito agrícola de Olmos, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque y ubicada a mas de hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en actividades agrícolas desde hace que era joven. Actualmente el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo donde ha instalado una plantación de maracuyá. Esta actividad le provee de ingresos permanentes los cuales utiliza en el mantenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Asterio desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes y algunas medicinas para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y asegurarse una buena cosecha. Por ello ha creíco conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Asterio es un hombre bastante tranquilo y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Asterio is a father and is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the town of Filoque, in a rural area that is located in the agricultural district of Olmos, an area in the province of Lambayeque. It is located more than 1 hour 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been working in agriculture since he was young. He has a small piece of farmland where he has planted with passion fruit. This provides him with a steady income that he uses to provide for his family. 

Asterio would like to buy some fertilizer and plant remedies to care for his crop and assure a good harvest. In order to do this, he is requesting a loan of PEN 2,000.00 from Edpyme Alternativa.

Asterio is a very level-headed and responsible man. He has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has been punctual in his payments.

loans.use: To buy some fertilizer and plant remedies to care for his crop

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío Cruce Jaén del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

 Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que tiene anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda este servicio en la ciudad de Olmos y en los caseríos de la zona. La actividad tiene mucha acogida ya que las mototaxis constituyen el medio de tansporte mas rapido y barato del lugar.

La zona en donde vive se caracteriza por tener caminos muy accidentados. Por ello su vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Para realizar esta acción el se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luis es una persona tranquila, responsable y bastante trabajadora. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 33 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in the town of Cruce Jaén, in the district of Olmos, an agricultural area of the province of Lamyeque. It is located 1 hour 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He provides transportation services for cargo and people in a motorcycle taxi. (This is a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that has a cabin mounted on the back for providing transportation services.) He provides this service in the city of Olmos and in the small towns of the region. This business is heavily used because motorcycle taxis are the quickest and least expensive mode of transport in the area. 

The area where he lives is characterized by streets where there are many traffic accidents. Because of this, his vehicle has started to have some problems that require urgent repairs so that it can continue to function. In order to do this, he is requesting a loan of PEN 1,000.00 from Edypme Alternativa. 

Luis is a level-headed person who is responsible and hardworking. Those who know him consider him to be honorable and trustworthy.

loans.use: To make repairs to his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Giancarlo

texts.es:
Giancarlo es un joven de 18 años de edad que reside junto a sus padres y hermanos en el caserío Guaraguaos del distrito de Tambogrande. Una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la crianza y venta de ovejas. El cría ovejas en su casa y las vende vivas a los negociantes de la zona o sacrificadas a sus vecinos. Este negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Giancarlo desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más ovejas y alimento balanceado de modo que su nivel de ingresos aumente y que esto le permita realizar otras acciones como estudiar una carrera superior. Por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 400 nuevos soles.

Giancarlo es un joven responsable y emprendedor, las personas que le conocen le tienen bastante estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Giancarlo is an18 year-old young man who lives with his parents and siblings in the town of Guaraguaos in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area of the province of Piura. It is located in a region of the same name, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque province.

He has been raising and selling sheep for more than one year. He raises sheep at his house and then sells them alive to businesspeople in the area, or already killed to his neighbors. This business allows him to cover his personal expenses and help his parents provide for the family.

Giancarlo would like to expand his business by buying more sheep and feed so that his income can increase, which would allow him to do other things, such as study for a higher degree. So, he has decided for the first time to request a loan of PEN 400.00 from Edpyme Alternativa. 

Giancarlo is a responsible and enterprising young man. Those who know him hold him in high esteem and trust in him.

loans.use: To buy sheep and feed so he can expand his business of raising and selling sheep.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la agricultura. En la zona la agricultura es la principal actividad productiva. Los productos que se suelen sembrar son mango, limón y maracuyá. Estos productos con vendidos a las plantas procesadoras de la zona las cuales distribuyen estas frutas en los mercados del extranjero. En su caso, ella ha sembrado mango y limón. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas y gallinas.

Lucila desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de algunos fertilizantes y pesticidas con los cuales desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Lucila es una mujer trabajadora y que da lo mejor de si para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer honrada y de confianza.
texts.en:
Lucila is a 52 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural area of the province of Piura. It is located in a region of the same name, more than 2.5 hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque province.

She works in agriculture. Agriculture is the main economic activity in the area. The products that people usually plant are mangos, limes, and passion fruit. These products are sold to the processors in the area which then distribute them in foreign markets. In her case, she has planted mangos and limes. She also raises and sells sheep and chickens. 

Lucila would like to expand her business by buying fertilizers and pesticides so she can care for her crops. So, she has decided for the first time to request a loan of  PEN 1,200.00 from Edpyme Alernative.

Lucila is a hardworking woman who gives everything she has to help her husband provide for their family. Those who know her consider her to be an honorable and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides so she can care for her mango and lime crops

loans.name: Jose Wilmer

texts.es:
José Wilmer es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a su hijo en el distrito pesquero de San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de seis años al procesamiento y comercialización de pescado seco – salado. El adquiere pescado fresco en el terminal pesquero de la región para luego procesarlo y venderlo en los diversos mercados de la zona. Su esposa lo apoya en esta actividad y juntos tratan de salir adelante y progresar apoyándose en su negocio.

José Wilmer desea adquirir más pescado fresco para así poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mas ingresos. Por ello ha decidido solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona tranquila y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
José Wilmer is a 31 year old father who lives with his wife and son in the fishing district of San José, an area that is part of the Lambayeque province, located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  

For over 6 years he has worked processing and selling dried salted fish.  He purchases fresh fish at the fishing port and then processes and sells it in many area markets.  His wife helps him and together they try to make progress and support each other in their business. 

José Wilmer would like to purchase more fresh fish in order to increase his sales and earn more income.  For this reason he has requested a loan of 1500 new sols from Edpyme Alternativa which he plans to use to achieve his goal.  

José is a relaxed and responsible person.  He has had prior loans with Edpyme Alternativa and has proven himself to be punctual and responsible with his payments.

loans.use: To acquire more fresh fish to increase his sales.

loans.name: Marlenny Esther

texts.es:
Marlenny es madre soltera, tiene 31 años y vive junto a su hijo en el distrito pesquero de San José, una zona que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la preparación y venta de alimentos en un local ubicado estratégicamente en una de las principales calles de su distrito. Por las mañanas vende ceviche y por las noches vende comidas rápidas en un carrito sanguchero. Sus negocios tienen mucha acogida en la zona debido al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes y a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus platos. Con los ingresos que percibe de estos negocios ella se encarga de sacar adelante a su menor hijo.

Marlenny desea adquirir algunos insumos con los cuales pueda ampliar la producción de su negocio. Ello le permitirá aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Marlenny es una mujer luchadora y que ha sabido salir adelante sola. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y bastante luchadora.
texts.en:
Marlenny is a 31 year old single mother who lives with her son in the fishing district of San José, an area which belongs to the province of Lambayeque, over twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She has prepared and sold food from a store which is strategically located in one of the main streets of the district. In the mornings she sells ceviche and at night she sells fast food from a hot dog stand. Her businesses are warmly welcomed in the district because of the good service she provides and her flair for cooking. She uses the income that she makes from these businesses to raise her youngest son.

Marlenny would like to purchase some supplies to increase her production and, in turn, increase her sales and her earnings. To achieve this objective she has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

Marlenny has a great fighting spirit and knows how to get ahead alone. The people who know her consider her to be a peaceful and courageous woman.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to increase production

loans.name: Fris

texts.en:
Fris C., age 36, owns and operates a pig-raising business. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live with their four school-aged children in the village of Pantaon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, Fris joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Fris has successfully repaid a loan of 40,000 PHP. She is now requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith B., age 57, harvests and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have six children. They live in the village of Malintubuan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

In 2009, Judith joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Judith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment. Judith is requesting a new loan of 14,800 PHP, which will be used to purchase more fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Judith from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es una madre D. familia D. 37 años D. edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Chepito del distrito D. Mórrope, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace doce años a la crianza y comercialización D. cerdos. Ella cría cerdos en diversos ambientes situados cerca D. su domicilio y los ofrece en venta a los negociantes D. la zona. Adicionalmente se dedica a la elaboración artesanal D. bordados. Con los ingresos D. estas actividades ella ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado y realizar algunas mejoras en los corrales donD. crían a sus animales, por ello ha decidido solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles con los que planea lograr su objetivo.

María es una mujer tranquila y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
María is a 37 year old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of Chepito in the Mórrope district, an agricultural area located in the province of Lambayeque, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She has raised and sold pigs for twelve years, raising them in different areas close to her home and selling them to dealers in the area. Maria also creates embroidered artworks, and with the income derived from both of these activities she is able to help her husband sustain their family.

Maria would like to purchase feed and make some improvements on the farmyard where they raise their animals, which is why she has decided to apply for the first time to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

Maria is a very responsible and peaceful woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of feed and farmyard improvements

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José Antonio tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el anexo Santa Rosa, una zona que pertenece al caserío Lagunas y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El ofrece su servicio en su caserío y en los caseríos aledaños. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de artículos fabricados en plástico para lo cual también se vale de su vehículo. Con estos ingresos el se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con los gastos familiares.

José desea realizar algunas reparaciones y brindar mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que esta ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de los caminos del lugar. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

José es una persona bastante responsable y tranquila. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para ayudar a su familia a obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 22 years of age, single and lives with his parents in Santa Rosa, a settlement which belongs to the hamlet of Lagunas in the district of Mórrope, an agricultural area which is part of Lambayeque province, one hour from the city of Chiclayo.

José offers a transport service for goods and passengers in a mototaxi, a motorised vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached. He offers this service both in his hamlet and in the surrounding hamlets. Additionally, he works selling goods made from plastic which he also uses his vehicle for. With this income he is able to cover his personal costs and help his family with the costs of living.

José would like to make some repairs on his mototaxi and put it in for maintenance as it already beginning to break down from excessive use and the bad state of the roads in his area. For this reason he has decided to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

José is a very peaceful and responsible person. His greatest wish is to continue growing as a businessman to help his family and work towards a better quality of life.

loans.use: Mototaxi repair and maintenance

location.town: Anexo Santa Rosa - Lagunas - Mórrope - Lambayeque

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia L., age 40, sells agricultural equipment to local farmers. She deals primarily in crop fertilizers such as manure. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. They have one school-aged child.

In 2009, Virgilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Virgilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Virgilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pat

texts.en:
Mr. Pat K., age 36, and his wife, Mrs. Horm Vat, age 37 (pictured) have a furniture-making business. In addition to assisting her husband in his business, Mrs. Horm Vat works as a local farmer. Mr. Pat Pheng makes his products from wood and rattan, which he purchases from middlemen at a reasonable cost. His finished products are primarily such items as beds and cupboards. 

His business is thriving because he sells his items to his customers at a reasonable price. In order to better satisfy current demand, Mr. Pat K. seeks a loan to purchase wood in order to build rattan cupboards for sale.

Mr. Pat K. and his wife are residents of Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. They have three school-aged children who help their parents make furniture when they have time available from studying.

loans.use: To purchase wood in order to build rattan cupboards for sale

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C. D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 65 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from it.

In 1999, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase new items to expand product offering. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Meresel

texts.en:
Meresel C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Meresel owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Meresel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month ftom it.

In 2009, Meresel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meresel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Meresel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Meresel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria G. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 62 years old, widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2002, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Gloria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda G., age 54, is a farmer. She plants and harvests fruits and vegetables, which she then offers for sale. Leonarda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Lawis Panalsalan and have four adult-aged children. 

In 2000, Leonarda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Leonarda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Leonarda is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 22nd loan taken out by Leonarda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 51 years old, widowed and has 11 adult-aged children. Trinidad owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily dried goods, in the local community. Trinidad has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2004, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Trinidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Trinidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Trinidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie P., 33 years old, is a loving and self-sacrificing mother of three children, all of them young and in need of her support. Vangie harbors a strong desire in her heart to increase her capital in order to acquire a larger inventory of fish in her stall, thereby creating more revenue for her family. Above all, she hopes to offer a better quality of life for her beloved children. Vangie is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP to pay for a pump boat for her husband to use to catch more fish and, with the remaining money, to purchase inventories of fish to sell in the market place. Let’s get together behind this devoted mother to help her bring well-being and security to the members of her family. Vangie believes that her business will help her family rise up and fight against poverty and will provide for the family's needs, especially in educating her three children. Her eldest child is a junior high school student and the other two are elementary students. Vangie is very grateful to ASHI and KIVA for their continuous support.

As a loyal member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1998, Vangie is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. She hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term to support her family's basic needs. The support of ASHI and Kiva lenders will enable Vangie to finally reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business, to invest in her home and to have a good life and a happy family. Despite various trials in her life, Vangie has never given up in her struggle against poverty.

loans.use: to pay for a pump boat and to purchase fish

loans.name: Fe Pekit Group

texts.en:
Fe P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Fe is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Fe is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Fe has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month from it.

In 2007, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Fe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

Ramonita E. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 45 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Ramonita owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Luzminda E. is from the village of Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years old. Luzminda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Luzminda E. Group.

Luzminda is married and has 3 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for sale. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Luzminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.name: Buth

texts.en:
Buth K. is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children who attend the local public school. Her husband is a farmer in Kompong Tom Province. In 2008, she began selling rattan beds. She also orders rattan items in bulk and then sells them door-to-door throughout the province. It always takes a week or two weeks to sell her products. 

This is currently the rainy season and a good time to grow crops. However, Buth K. and her husband do not have any capital yet for their farm. Buth K. is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers and insecticides for growing crops on their farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Verginia has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Verginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Verginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Verginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Verginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, a mother of two, is 45 years old. She is a hard-working entrepreneur who wants to be able to help her family. Working closely with her husband Reynato, she makes and sells ready-to-eat food. She started the business seven years ago to help her family meet its education expenses, as well as water, electricity and food expenses. All of these items are very expensive.  

Now, Gina has requested 35,000 PHP as additional working capital for her business. She is positive that her business will grow, since she already has regular customers in her local area submitting orders. Specifically, the loan will be used to buy more ingredients. She is pleased because, in the past, she has managed to utilize the loans to invest in her business.

With working capital, Gina's business will continue to grow and she will be able to provide excellent products to her regular customers. With the support of KIVA lenders, Gina hopes to improve the standard of living for herself and her family and lift them out of poverty. 
 
She dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her food in order to earn a much larger income. Gina is grateful to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

During the course of her membership in ASHI, Gina has been a model member, dedicated to managing her family’s operations.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients

While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Eleanor has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eleanor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleanor is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eleanor from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan L. is 52 years old and a married woman. She and her husband are rattan cupboard sellers in Kompong Tom Province. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their five children. Two of the kids are attending school, and the other three are working at different occupations. In the business activities, her husband also assists her in buying and selling rattan cupboard along the road. This family normally earns an average of $6 per day to help cover their family’s daily living expenses. Chan L. now is selling well because she has good public communication skills. To meet the needs of her customer, Chan L. is applying for a loan to buy more of rattan cupboards to sell.

Sokun and her husband are silk weavers. Besides this, her husband is a construction worker as well. Sokun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Pakpattan, a small city in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over 15 years.  She has 2 sons who have not started attending school yet.

Razia is an embroidery artist by profession. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs onto dresses.  The attraction of her work is that she never use any embroidery machines; she relies only on her hands to make her beautiful designs. She sells her work primarily to her neighbors. She has a good reputation among her clients and earns good income every month from her work. 

Razia is married to T. H., a milk seller by profession. T. has some buffalos at home which provide milk. His clients, including various milk shop owners, are from surrounding areas. He sells milk to them to generate income for the family. 

Razia is a regular client of Asasah, a Kiva partner. She has proved herself to be a dependable client, and has never missed a meeting. She is making her 2nd loan application for a loan for her husband’s business.  He will use the money to buy another buffalo and increase his milk supply, which will increase his income as well. She is hopeful that her husband will make good use of his 10 years of experience in the dairy business to get maximum output from this investment. She also hopes that she will be able to send her children to school soon with the increased income generated by the loan. 

Note: In the photo, Razia is holding a blue book.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn T. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 55 years old, married, and has 7 children. To make a living, Evelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting, and selling rice. She has been engaged in her business for over 26 years.

Evelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI, and is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm essentials. This will be Evelyn’s seventh loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve it.

loans.name: Koim

texts.en: Koim K. is a 42-year-old village woman who has a job as a rice farmer in the province of Kompong Tom. Koim K.’s husband is a local fisherman who helps her with the family. Koim K. owns a small farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. Koim K. currently plants a peanut crop and she estimates that she will harvest it within the next two months when the plants mature. She will use the profit from selling her mature produce to better meet her family’s needs. Koim K. thinks that it is time to expand her planting, but her farmland is not big. Therefore, Koim K. would like a loan of $250 in order to purchase a piece of land for her planting.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for her planting.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.en:
Saltanat K. is 41 years old.  She graduated from Pedagogical Institute and currently works as a primary school teacher at the school in Besh-Kayindy village. Her colleagues characterize her as a very optimistic and responsible person.   Saltanat has four children: her elder son studies at the Institute of Arts and dreams of being a famous musician and the others are schoolchildren.

Unfortunately, salaries of teachers in rural areas are low and do not cover the family’s expenses.  For this reason, Saltanat started her own business in cattle breeding. She used 5,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase cattle for fattening, and she resold it at the local livestock market on weekends.  Saltanat worked hard to make her business successful and today has three milk cows, seven goats and one horse.  Using the revenues from selling fattened cattle, she was able to pay for the education of her elder son. 

Saltanat plans to use the loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her business by purchasing sheep and bull calves. With the revenues from this investment, Saltanat plans to reconstruct her house. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old. Gemma is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gemma works hard for her family, especially for the future of her child. She says she wants to give her child a bright future.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and seeds. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Gemma from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Didas

texts.en: Didas is a father to five children. They are all above nine years of age and live in Fort Portal, Uganda. Besides having his own children, he has other dependants he is looking after. He also owns a house where he lives with his family but it has not stopped him from having a family dream, which is to educate his children and improve his household income.  Didas distills alcohol. He has been in this business for five years and hasn’t seen any hardships at the moment, making him believe in expanding his business in the near future. He needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Lolita

To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing rice tractor services in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is the resident of Pakpattan which is a small city located in Punjab Pakistan and known for its sugar production. She owns a 2 room brick house (in the area named 14SP) and lives in it with her 2 daughters, a son and her husband. Naseem is a 28 year old skillful lady. She operates her embroidery business at her home to support her family, financially. She couldn’t enroll her children into school due to financial constraints. 

Naseem's husband is a milkman by profession. He has a milk shop in the market. He has a contract with the milk suppliers who supply milk to him for his shop. His business is going well but, he has to pay the amount to the supplier before selling the milk. So he has decided to buy a buffalo for the purpose of milk production. This will mean that he never has to pay the amount to the supplier, but will sell milk from his own buffalo. Therefore, Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah to help her husband in his business. With the loan, her husband will buy the buffalo for producing milk and will sell it through his shop. Naseem hopes that her husband will receive a good profit by implementing his new idea for his business. 

Naseem is a regular loan user from Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has always paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hand is Naseem”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for dairy business.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Haydee is married and has 6 children. Her eldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is only 3. She is involved in farming and has been planting and harvesting rice crops for more than a few years now. She has also started raising pigs for breeding. Haydee wishes to fulfill her dreams and one of those dreams is to see all of her children finish college and have bright futures. She says raising 6 children is not easy but she finds comfort in knowing she and her husband support each other in efforts to keep their family intact.

Haydee joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Haydee has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Haydee is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and also feeds for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 49-year-old man, married, with seven children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He lives with his family in a semi permanent home and his dream is to educate his children and improve the well-being of his family. Peter has had a tailoring business for the last 30 years. This has enabled him to farm which has helped him get enough capital to start up a side business. He has the challenge of clients failing to pay on time, though it has not stopped him from improving his business and the trade in general by training more tailors. Peter needs this loan to buy chicks for a poultry project and also to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy chicks for a poultry project and also pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
This is Chona M., 50, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Vergel M., a driver, and she is mother to five youngsters. Two of the children are currently enrolled in high school while the three others are in elementary. By the grace of God, Chona has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually support her children and send them all the way through college.

Chona operates a variety store and a woodworking business. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling the items at a piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP11, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy woodworking supplies. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Chona dreams to be able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of the loan to buy woodworking supplies.

loans.name: Hanifaan's Group

texts.en:
Hanifaan is a housewife. She lives in a small area of the city of Pakpattan, named 14SP, with her family, in a small home. Pakpattan is located in Punjab and known for its sugar production. Hanifaan is a 56 year old lady who spends most of her time at home doing her household responsibilities. Her husband has a business of selling fruits. He puts the fruits on his four-wheeled cart every day and sells them by going through different streets of the city. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years. 

Hanifaan is the mother of a son who is also involved in the fruit selling business. Her son sells fruits at his shop, which he has on rent. It is located in the market. He also contributes to the family income from his fruit business.  

Hanifaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy seasonal fruits and increase his sales. She is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to improve his business by making this investment. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meetings.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hand is Hanifan”.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business.
